text: If only I can give more than 5 stars I will. One of the best sushi place in vegas. Must try all their special rolls! I mean...all of them! Outstanding customer service from Server leslie "bedman" and great ambiance to hangout. Two thumbs up!!!
Definitely great service here ! Carlos treated us very well.  Food was fresh. Hamachi kama is thr best, must have !!

Awesome!!!
Fastest service. Fully satisfied. 
Best all you can eat Sushi restaurant you can find.
Very nice place, affordable prices, good for big companies. Just few minutes from the Strip. I recommend.

I went in for all you can eat sushi, I made the biggest sushi mistake ever. Not even one sushi chef is Japanese. My expectations were way too high for this place because I was expecting a Japanese food. Wow! Don't go here for sushi. I visit Japan for business and private vacation. I speak fluent and I know the culture well, this place is not Japanese. Very disappointed.

The service here is exceptional! Our server "Tinker Bell" was very friendly and explained questions we had about the menu. Also, the food and service here is so much better than the location on Flamingo and Maryland parkway. This location has the same menu items but the food seems fresher and has a better taste! Also it's not cramped and packed. Of course we went on a Saturday at 4pm but still. Definitely worth a check out!

This place isn't too bad. it's really cute inside and I was seated fairly quickly. The sushi was actually really good and the service was pretty much great until one of the waitresses was being weird and rude to my friend and I. As my friend is ordering rolls she cuts him off and says "NO", then after we order our dessert the same waitress says "you guys are fat asses haha" ummm wat. I feel like that's very rude to say to any customer and definitely made us both feel extremely uncomfortable. Don't know what her deal was but ok anyways good service and good sushi, just watch out for that rude waitress lolz.

This is by far the best all you can eat sushi place I've tried in a very long time. The selection of the sushi was excellent. The other delicacies on the menu was also very good. You always leave this place super full!  It is well worth the money. If you come here make sure you come with an empty stomach because you will be leaving this place happily like a stuffed chicken!  A must go!

We went for the all u can eat sushi dinner. It was good, some stuff was more spicy that advertised but very tasty. The service was good, waitresses constantly checked to see if you need anything else or how things are going. They allow you to order half rolls and dessert is included, great pistachio ice cream.

For someone visiting from the Bay Area, you don't really find AYCE sushi spots, let alone a place that serves FRESH sushi AT $24/person!! Great price and great selection.

HOWEVER, one of my main critiques was its inconsistency. It became difficult trying to order food as different servers took our order and our order got lost in transit haha. I suggest they have a menu where you can mark your choices to minimize the chaos.

Honestly if I could give no stars I would! We had party of 14 and the service was terrible from start to finish. They took 20 minutes to give us our water on top of hour wait when they said it would be a 30-40 minute wait. We only came here because it was our last resort. We wished we just stayed at Goyemon because the wait was just as long. When it was time to have our order taken, the food took forever and they kept forgetting orders. We had to ask other servers and the only guy that was really attentive to our party was the Filipino dude (wishing we got his name because he was the only one serving us) We ordered three times and never got any of those orders we had to keep asking. The last straw for me was when we ordered edamame and the table next to us who was there long after we arrived got their edamame. Seriously, we waited 30 minutes and I had to tell them to cancel the order because at that point we were beyond upset. My sister ordered a white tuna shortly after and she never got that either. The waitress who originally served us paid us no attention after we complained that we never got any of our food.  We saw the sushi makers just standing around.  The quality of the sushi was very mediocre. The sushi rice overpowered the sushi and was too vinegary. Honestly the worst sushi restaurant we've been too! I don't normally review restaurants but the service was so horrible that I had to. And the fact that our party was a big party the tip was included. They honestly didn't deserve 18% Seriously that's how horrible it was.  I would never reckoned this place to anyone and definitely won't be back. Honestly there are so much other sushi places with better sushi and service.

Ok the price was decent.
Food was fair.
The bbq rib was amaaaaazing!
For the sushi, tuna wasn't good but the rest was ok.
Food came out fast.
Server was nice think her name is Grace, seems to be the only Korean there.
I would give 5 stars if the rice was decent but wasn't.
It was too dry so fell off from the dish when dipped in the soy sauce.
Other than that, very nice.
I'd definitely go back.

Probably the most popular Sushi place in Vegas. The sushi is amazing, but the space and service....it's really small and cramped. You're so close to the stranger that just got seated next to you and you feel like you can't have a convo with your guest. The staff forget to check up on you. They've got AYCE.

I have eaten here many times but the last two times have been horrible. I have even brought big groups here before. We walked in tonight and the place was not as busy and we asked for a booth. We thought the wait would not be long when we asked, but "Betty Boop" (they wear nametafs thatbare not their real names)said it was a 30 minute wait for a booth. We decided to wait for a booth and she actually seated us 5 minutes later. When we got to our booth, Filipino Server (Wolverine) didn't look like he was in the mood and actually looked very irritated when taking our order. 

One of our Salmon Nigiri orders had bones in the fish or something crunchy but I believe it was bones. That's so nasty. This place was great when it opened but the service has really gone down hill. They don't come around and ask and follow up even if it was really slow. We had to ask for water refills twice. 

I will say this that there are two or theee excellent servers every time we come here. Two of those are Mulan and Go Slow Bro. I don't know if I'll be coming back. Sushi Neko up the road may be my sushi choice when I'm in this area.
The first location on flamingo is much better. The food here was very mediocre. Not bad but not very good either. I won't be returning.

Very disappointed at this place, customer service sucks. Came with a party of five and everyone got their foods but me literally took more than 45 minutes for them to realize there was a "miscommunication". It's really annoying how we have to wait longer to even get our food. Her NAME was Myra
Excellant sushi , very creative dishes for a great price . Nice clean modern resturaunt.
Tasty Yellow Tail collar.  Decent selection of sushi.  Uni is not very fresh, I would not recommend it.  Try it twice and it is the same result...

Very impressed with this place. Moving from Los Angeles, Vegas sushi could never amount to the dozens of amazingly fresh sushi places in LA. This was changed when I came to Yama. The fish tastes fresh, the service is quick, and the all-you-can eat option is totally worth your money! I recommend this place to all of my friends and it is my go-to sushi spot. It is a must try!

All you can eat, five stars, the wet dream roll was absolutely excellent. 

Great service, food comes out very quickly, absolutely great

In comparison to the original Yama, Yama Sushi 2 (second branch)definitely has the freshest selection between the two. The only down fall to Yama Sushi 2 is the service which is regrettably slow. It may take up to 30 min to receive a half roll and sometimes your order is forgotten. If you find yourselves waiting close to 25-30 mins to get someone to take or return your check then I would recommended standing up, I've seen this from other (albeit more frustrated) patrons, and gently flag someone down. Still, the food is amazing and the servers try their best to get your order taken and delivered. Management needs to work something out on the lines of customer to server ratio.

Yama Sushi has 2 locations un Las Vegas, one closer to Hard Rock Casino and the other in Chinatown, both offer all-you-can-eat sushi for 20.95 (lunch) or 23.95 (dinner). Their menu is big, and as longer as you can fit in your stomach, keep ordering, their service is really fast! Make sure you order the items selected as "one per person", those are special items and they are worth to order! #vegas #sushi  Ps.: Chinatown location looks fancier than the other but both service and food are the same, if you are in a business or romantic occasion, go to Chinatown.
Best sushi place in vegas! Never have to wait too long, service is quick, and the sushi is BOMB

I went here for their $23 AYCE dinner and I thought it was average. Our server wasn't too familiar with the menu. Their miso soup was also a bit bitter. I highly recommend their soft shell fried crab and their baked and fried mussels. I wish they served oysters here. Most of the food that I ordered were from the appetizer section. I wasn't too impressed with the rolls we ordered either. I don't remember which ones they were but hopefully the pictures that I post will help. Sorry! One of them was the "Ellen" roll though. Lol it's pretty spacious inside and I really liked the lighted frames. I felt like I was eating sushi in the mountains. Lol if you're looking for an AYCE sushi joint, definitely give this one a shot.
This is our second time here. We like how more spacious this location is compared to their other location. The AYCE is of good value. The service is good. We look forward to coming here again.
Soooooo happy it's open closer to us now! Went last Friday night and we will be back this Friday. Yum! Yum! Yum!! Tip- the "seafood salad" is awesome!

Looking for DOH in Spring Mountain, drove back & forth looking for it, confused to not find it on yelp/maps anymore... Come to find out it was bought out by YAMA 3 weeks ago! Well, no wonder we couldn't find it. -____- But we came for sushi and we were already there, so we decided to try it out. Same decor & layout as Doh previously had it, just different menu...

We ordered:
ROLLS:
- No name roll x 2
- Wet dream 
- Turning Japanese 
- Yama crunch 
- Eel nigiri x3
- Salmon nigiri x2
APPETIZERS:
- Baked green mussels x2 (4 pieces each order)
- Soft shell crab x2
- Dynamite
- Miso soup
- Edamame 
DESSERT:
- Green tea mochi
- Strawberry mochi 

Wasn't too impressed with the menu selection, but did like that each specialty roll on the menu had a little picture so you had an idea of what you are getting. Also, dinner is also only $23.95 (most AYCE sushi places are around $27)! Service was very attentive, but we did have 3 different people checking up on us -- so we often had to say, "Oh, we already told the other server." Made it a tad confusing at times. But overall, a decent dining experience... just nothing I would go out of my way for.

PRO TIP: Order half rolls so you can try different ones out. That way you get 4 pieces versus 8 if you end up not liking it. And if you do like it, you can always order more!

Nice environment in a fun part of town. 

However; sitting at the sushi bar, we frequently found ourselves with empty plates, looking longingly at the sushi chefs - trying to get some attention. We had to actively flag down waitstaff to get refills on water or tea.

It wasn't a particularly crowded or busy evening. When someone is three feet away, and repeated "Excuse me's" are not acknowledged... Well, we definitely felt ignored.

The food...
eh.... on the average side of average.
The nigiri pieces were decent sized, but the rice would not hold together, and was fairly bland. The rolls are exactly what you expect at this kind of place - funny names, but no more than serviceable as food. 

I've had much better experiences at the East Side Yama, even though it is loud and tightly packed.

I have been an avid patron to the yama on flamingo for years and this restaurant is just as delicious. My only problem with this new establishment is that drinks are not included in the AYCE price which is different the primary location on flamingo. I was a little upset when i got the bill with an extra 10 dollars tacked on so just beware. I feel as thought the servers should have informed us on this detail.

For cheap all you can eat sushi this is the place to go. My friends and I usually end up ordering more than a hundred dollars worth of sushi each. The price here is unbeatable for the amount of food you can eat in a 2 hour time frame.
I love this place! The service is decently fast and the sushi is just so good. You can't beat the price for all you can eat and how good their rolls are.
A must whenever we are in Vegas. All you can eat, fresh sushi and sashimi and uni. Loved the price
Great food and nice atmosphere! Out of all the sushi AYCE places in Vegas,  Umiya and Yama are the two favorites!

This a great place and price for All you can eat sushi. If you visit, make sure to ask for Carlos, aka "sexy daddy", he will take care of you and recommend some delicious food. Carlos gave us an amazing service.

Sushi is delicious and always tastes fresh! I wouldn't wait until your hungry to come here because they are always busy and will have to wait around for awhile, but it's worth the wait. PLUS, it's all you can eat! Yummy...yummy for my tummy.

i give this visit a 4  (Keep in mind i've eaten at top sushi places in japan. lol)

Customer Service: The waiters/waitresses were really good about continuously checking if we wanted to put in another order and clearing off the plates that we had finished eating. 

Food: I like how the chefs did not put on too much rice with the fish. the salmon was pretty good quiality. tasted like the cut came from near the belly. also had ikura, spicy ahi, saba, soft shell crab. lastly the uni portion could've been a little more. i got only half the tongue per nigiri. 

Price: for $23 / person AYCE at dinner time, that's actually the best price we have found so far. 

Will keep this one on our radar to return.
Although it was crowded, the customer service, price, and AYCE options are unparalleled to other sushi restaurants. I will undoubtedly be back for more!
First time I went there I got food poisoning and the second time I went I got colitis... should of gotten the hint the first time but I was stupid

So I've tried the Yama Sushi on E Flamingo and loved it, but that location is always soo crowded. When I saw that a Yama was on my side, I was eager to go. Much to my disappointment, the service is horrible, the sushi is okay, and the selection is so much more limited. Sad to say, I will not be returning to Yama. I guess I will go to Umiya. Umiya has a much better selection and the quality is way better.

Came here for dinner one night as mom wanted to come to this place. I had always been a bit skeptical about going to this Yama since i didn't have that good of an experience at the other Yama on Flamingo. 

We had came here on a Tuesday night, seated fairly quickly as soon as we arrived. We had ordered some stuff to test out the place. Tuna, White Tuna, Yellow tail, salmon, sweet shrimp, giant clam, ikura, uni, tuna poki salad, soft shell crab, agedashi tofu, hamachi kama, dynamite, salmon skin hand roll, custom handroll consisting of salmon, avocado, and ikura. 

Out of the top items ordered, the best was...... the custom hand roll. Belly portion of the salmon so a fatty piece of salmon with ikura and avocado. The salmon nigiri was decent but only 2 of the 4 pieces. 2 were ok fatty, 2 were lean. 

Worst? tuna poki. dont know what the heck they used in terms of sauce but it was gross. Not any kind of poke i've ever had. Seemed like a variety of sauces mixed with each other. Flavors dont meld well together. Was spicy, salty, weird bittery taste. I dont even want to think if the tuna was fresh or not.

Hamachi kama was huge but flavorless. Wasn't seared/broiled enough. 

Nigiri overall, the rice was gross. Mushy. 

Yellowtail had some ponzu sauce over it with green onions. 

Giant clam (geoduck) is not fresh. Does not have that "crisp" feeling. Kind of mushy. 

Salmon skin handroll consisted of bitsy pieces of salmon with little skin. Not crispy at all. Salmon meat way more than skin.  Should call it a cooked salmon hand roll

Not a fan of rolls to begin with so didnt order any of those. Didn't see anything that stood out that wasnt covered in sauces or weird. 

The soft shell crab had a weird batter. Very different from what you'd find from other restaurants. Theirs flakes off too easily. 

Service wise, it was attentive in some aspects but unattentive in other aspects. It took a while for us to get the check and dessert but they were fairly good with refilling tea and taking orders. 

Overall, meh. Definitely not a fan of this place. Not for those who are interested in nigiri. Rolls and what not may be better but not my cup of tea. Not to mention the parking is horrible at most meal times here.
Wasn't that great. Never coming back here. Service was bad. The guy in the blue shirt was rude. Waited for our check for 30 minutes.

Been to many all you can eat , this was not very good at all .

The menu posted here online is totally different from their menu.

Tempura oily, grilled steak and pork ,dry smothered in the same out of the bottle teriyaki all told never will go back .

Dessert one little Moche small ice cream disappointed for the money.

Sushi is delicious. Service is shit. Worked in the service industry for years and I expect great customer service. Jolibee (the server) was very blah and had negative energy. Many servers helped the whole floor so I'm guessing it's fair split of the pot amongst all of them. But her service was so bad that it made the experience unenjoyable.

My husband and I come here all the time and always have an amazing experience. And today's visit is no different!!! Everyone is so so nice! Especially #SATAN! Thank you #SATAN for making this visit so wonderful!! Thanks SATAN!
It was okay, not the best AYCE in Vegas. Not the place for you if you want real sushi. Most of their rolls were drenched with sauce, not my cup of tea.

First time here, check the review and was very skeptical. So i took a chance, never regreted since.
Since its All You Can Eat, i expect bad sushi rolls and poor aperizers. I was wrong.

Sushi rolls were great, service was stellar, aperizers was suprisingly addicting plus free 2 scoop ice cream and mochi. Great deal!

AYCE for $23.95 per person
Will come back again  :)

I've been a regular at doh for months now and after it's been changed to Yama sushi there are quite a few disappointments. First is the services. I don't know if it's the servers fault or the chefs, but a lot of times I never get what I ordered. Dishes are missing and I have to reorder again and again. Next is the rice, it is soggy and crumbling when you pick it up. One last thing is whenever my family gets seated, the seat is always dirty! There's crumbs of food and that irritates me so much. 
But other than that , it's okay.
Service was so horrible. Brought out wrong rolls, incomplete orders, and when asked to correct the order... the waitress rolled her eyes.... and water never filled. Food is not worth the service.

I extremely excited to find a second, and more of a mid location, between my family and I. It's pretty much the same menu, and flavors are the same as the original for me. 
I like their customer service a tad bit more than the original though 'cause it has more space and less crowded to give their wait staff more time to pay attention to you. At least that's how it was for me and the fiance when we went around 5:30PM on a Friday.
The only thing I found kinda weird is the setting/theme of this location. After reading other Yelp reviews, I realized they haven't been able to redecorate - Doh was still painted in the background of the sushi bar.
Awesome food and staff ;) MULAN!!! Is the besttttt !!!! in love this place already . They always think about the customer more than anything else.

We love to go to the old Yama, but due to a large party we decided to go to this one on Spring Mountain. The food was great however the seat attendant told us it would take 20 minutes before we could be seated ended up being well over an hour and a half. 

After we got a table, one of the waitresses was placing a Styrofoam cup of apple juice on the table when it tore & spilled onto my daughter and niece. Just thanking God it wasn't a hot beverage. We didn't blame the waitress, but hoping the restaurant can invest in some higher quality products. 

There was a bit of attitude from the waitresses while taking our orders as well. My 2 year old is a picky eater, but she loves the miso soup with the extra tofu (that's all she eats at Sushi restaurants) so I specifically asked for it. When it came out, It was evident the bowl did not have much tofu. My daughter finished it quickly and asked for more. I asked the waitress for another bowl with more tofu than the last. And she told me they're working on it and rolled her eyes.  

If it wasn't for the larger space, we probably wouldn't choose this Yama restaurant over the other one.

Have been a patron of the Flamingo location, through the cramped quarters and sometimes questionable service, for a decade now and learned of the new second location in Chinatown (in the former 'Sushi Doh). The parking is rough, especially weekend evenings! It is however, worth it. Same AYCE menu, same favorites but in a far more open atmosphere with a quicker and more attentive service. Even the Sushi Bar is more spacious.  Sure, there's still a wait but,  like it's sister locale,  it's deliciously worth it.

I loved going to the Yama near Maryland when I was going to UNLV! So I was ecstatic that they opened a location in Chinatown!

First off the space, so much room! Wide sushi bar, and plenty of tables. Several sushi chefs, and plenty of staff who check up on you, I think that's wonderful! 

Sushi is tasty, and comes out fast. They have all the rolls they had before at the other location. Appetizers/sides are a miss for me here. Chicken skewers are hard to chew and dry, I don't recommend it at all.
The hamachi kama and salmon kama was disappointing, both were incredibly small and dry. 
Seafood salad has shrunk considerably.
I would love to see Yama improve this.

I say save your stomach room, and just go for the nigiri and rolls. Do try thier baked rolls, its amazing in the mouth!!

This location is literally my favorite. Even though it isnt as good as the original Yama, so worth coming here. There is less waiting time and the ambiance is so much nicer and less crowded. 

This is literally my favorite sushi place in all of las vegas. All the fish is super fresh and all the rolls are super delicious. The staff are super friendly and attentive. You never have to ask them to refill your drinks or pick up your dishes. THEY ARE ON TOP OF THEIR GAME!!! Snow in Vegas and No Name are some of my most favorite rolls on the menu.

I will forever be loyal to Yama sushi. I've tried others and I've been super let down as they don't compare.
The best AYCE sushi in the city. Service is unique and passionate. Food is fresh and delicious. Place is cool and clean. Will be visiting many more times. Love the place!

Me and my girlfriend went there the Food was good and tasted fresh. The service was horrible extremely slow and the place wasn't busy. We literally sat at the table with empty plates while the waiter fumbled around doing nothing.

Some what similar menu, different (bigger) location.

For starters, why wasn't a new Yelp page made for the new location?
DOH wasn't that great but why confuse people and not differentiate the two? Have Yama really earn their reviews and stars instead of reflecting off of DOH or mixing the two!
The place still felt like DOH, but with Yama menu, I'm sure they're still working on it.

The waiters/waitresses were attentive and friendly but I didn't like how it seemed like they were yelling every time someone walked in.
Maybe tone it down to a 5, since everyone working has to greet anyways, lol.

Now about the food..
My all time favorite (and would probably crave here and there) is the "Wet Dream" roll! Baked, cream cheesy, shrimpy goodness!
Then maybe "No Name", then "Sun of the Beach".

Their nigiris looked good, not too much rice and fish looked fresh, but I am more of a roll type of person! They also have a good amount of appetizers or sides to choose from.

I haven't been to Yama sushi in years, but after dining here recently I'm not too crazy about it..
I just honestly wasn't impressed. ¯\_(?)_/¯

Food was alright.. waitress was rushing us and fucked up our whole order. They didn't even ask if we wanted to just order individual rolls or do all you can eat but just assume we were doing all you can eat. The others in our party end up waiting close to an hr for 2 rolls and at that time most of us had already finish eating.
worst japanese food. place smells and its old. terrible and horrible. staff are not friendly

I went for a late dinner last night for the AYCE. The hostess was great. She greeted promptly and sat us quickly. The waiters and waitresses are another story. We had to order our drinks 3 different times before they brought it out. We ordered our first round of sushi and after that we didn't see the waiter for atkeast 20mins. I kept trying to flag him down so that we can order and he kept ignoring me and continued to help everyone around us. Finally I had to ask another waitress to take our order. 

The food was mediocre. The mussels were over cooked and the nigiri did not taste fresh at all. The only good I can say is the price is really good.  once I asked another waitress to assist us we were no longer waiting so long. I am a stickler for customer service.

This place is so terrible! I never recommend anyone to eat here. It isn't worth it. I stopped there one Saturday, and the host seated two of us. Shortly after we waited 15 minutes for someone to take our drink order. Another 10 for our food order. It was terrible. We had a new server every time someone came by our table. They were rude and unhelpful. When our rolls arrive the servers stopped coming to our table. Eventually we had to wave the hostess down. She was helpful. The rolls weren't even all that good either. The California roll tasted really fishy. More fishy than usual. Like they used cheap imitation crab. I wanted more rolls but no one else came by and we decided to leave. Here's the funny part. THEY LOCK YOU IN! I think in fear of people eating and running (the all you can eat sushi). We had to go up to the hostess and ask for our ticket. She got it and I paid for it. My friend attempted to go outside while I paid and the door wouldn't budge. He turned and said the doors locked. He noticed The hostess slyly push a button under her stand and the doors unlocked. What the f*** kind of sh** is that?!! We ate there for lunch. I told her the service was awful and I plan never to return. She was snooty after that. I HIGHLY RECOMMEND THAT NO ONE GO HERE! Save your time and money! Go somewhere else!
Had 2 rounds of AYCE sushi and then staff completely ignored the party. Had to ask the receptionist for the check and even then got ignored and attitude.

Agree with most other reviewers that the sushi isnt amazing. Employees were very friendly, but service was slow. Took long for sushi to come out and got appetizers late, but they did give us sushi we didnt order and said it was ok if we didnt finish it. It is cheaper than most places at $20.95 for AYCE lunch and menu does have a lot to choose from. They forgot some of our orders. Idk how when it was not that busy during friday at 1pm. Also I dont know what happened, but this place used to be called Do'h. Its now called Yama which lm assuming is like the one near UNLV, but nowhere as good. Although employees were super nice, I recommend taking a pass at this place. Theres lots of other sushi places nearby in chinatown with much fresher fish.

This place rocks!!! Ayce Sushi is my fav. You can eat any sushi on the menu. The service is great...the girls are on it. Parking is a breeze. It's not too far off the strip. Price is great...quite a bargain I think. This place is on my list to visit every time I come to Vegas!!! Great job people!!! I would recommend this place highly!!!

Been here a few times and the sushi has always been great. Today though, the group and I had a waitress who was a bit unpleasant. Hopefully its just cause shes having a bad day but still, dont take it out on the people you're serving. Ya'll are great still though!
The wait for ordering food is so long and they also forget your food. The customer service is just terrible. Save your money and go somewhere else.

It's in the heart of Chinatown.  We picked it because it was pack so that means food is good! Got in for 2 no wait they are pretty big for a sushi restaurant. Their waitresses don't keep still they circle the tables getting your orders in fast. And it comes out fast and delicious. We had the hamachi fresh as can be for the desert. Large portions too. We did half orders on Hawaii, sun of the beach, one night at Yama, oh dam harry! I will try the Harry Potter too! Will definitely come back again. Only thing missing my fried shumai. The appetizers were great too!

I'd like to start this review off and say that the quality of sushi/food is good, which is the only reason for my 2 star review. However, what really brought my experience down was the lack of customer service this place has. Me and my husband waited 15 minutes before anyone came to our to ask if we wanted to order anything else. The only reason someone actually came to our table was because I had my hand up trying to wave someone down. We had our plates stacked up because we already finished our sushi rolls...and still no one came. No one even came to fill up our waters after seeing our glasses empty. I do not usually complain, but the lack of initiative and urgency the servers had was mediocre. This is unfortunate because I usually loved dining at this location for Doh Sushi, however now that this establishment has replaced it.. I don't think I will be coming back.
This is better than the original Yama! Not a long wait and very spacious. Food was amazing!

Doh where did you go?!?  Even though it was do Doh we decided to give this new "stand in" sushi bar a try... As mentioned below, we were seated and had our drink order placed.  20 mins later a waiter named "goofy" came by to make sure we were ok.  He quickly apologized for the delay and said "I'm not sure what they are doing?"  
This was all ok, even the fact that nothing we came for was available.  It was once the sushi came we started to lose our appetite.  The eel sauce had a very strong burnt burnt flavor.  They do have a lot of rolls to chose from, so maybe I picked the wrong rolls. I just don't know if I'll be back now that I know Doh is gone. Sorry Yama

All you can eat sushi.  Not too shabby. Was here with my colleague for work and we  wanted a local hangout sushi house outside the strip. 

All you can eat includes drinks (except liquor), and free dessert. Can't go wrong with any of their sushi rolls.  They're also huge potions. For only $23, you get to eat as much sushi, bento and tempura to your heart's desire. 

Cheers!
My favorite is the hamachi kama!  Plus the staff is always so friendly!

Came here around 1 am because I heard it was great.  Had to do to go because I was so exhausted and didn't have the energy to dine in.  I am still sitting here as I'm writing this yelp review.  Pretty sure they forgot about 3 rolls and edamame.  No one to assist in the front so I had to walk inside to find out what was going on.  The waitress was at her station and when I flagged someone down to ask what is taking so long.  PS I work 2 doors down from you guys so mind you I was being extremely patient.  When the server finally saw me she made the basic "Oh shit" face!  Here's the kicker I asked right next to your sushi chef and when I informed them it's going on 30 minutes for a to go order they laughed.  Such poor service!!!!!!  Good luck with the staff you have!

I had a horrible experience. Terrible service terrible sushi just OVERALL TERRIBLE. Why is everyone refilling waters and not taking orders for food? I had ONE CUP of coke the whole night and asked for a refill three times. Twice to the same waitress and once to the waiter serving the table next to us. I will never come back and would not recommend this to anybody. I hope they close down at all locations. I had a table of 6 and all of us had the worst experience of sushi EVER! But as soon as I ask for the check, they rushed it right back to the table in a heartbeat. All they care about is throwing nasty food (sucks to much to call sushi) and taking our money.

Super disappointed in the service here from my past two visits. This is my family's favorite spot to eat and it saddens me that they have missed the mark with us twice in a row. I definitely understand being busy, but in my opinion it comes down to the servers and sushi chefs lack of communication. I've had to place orders in numerous times only for them to never make it to our table. Manwhore was made poorly and not baked long enough. Long wait to get seated, longer wait to get your food. 

The reason this review is getting only 1 star is because they charged me 107.92 the first time because their cashiers put in a tip in the wrong amount. Although they voided it out and charged the correct amount I would have appreciated being in the loop rather than waiting for 20 minutes for our check and an explanation as to what's going on. A dismissive sorry and refusal to give the managers name did not make the situation any better. 

I will say if you are lucky enough to have the young Korean lady as your waiter your experience will be nothing like this. She always remembers my son when we come in. 

I really hope I'm able to come back to this review and rate Yama what it truly deserves but as of this moment I definitely think their staff needs to go through some training.

My family and I went to this location again and surprisingly the food was very delicious. We were seated in 5 mins (luckily we beat the dinner crowd). We were seated in the darker side which was a bit too dim to read our menus but it was alright and we used our phone light. 
The food was very fresh and so good! As always the food here is pretty amazing. 
However, I docked a star because the waitress forgot a few of our orders (AGAIN lol see previous review). So we realized we didn't receive our order about 20mins we asked our server again and she said that the order was never placed and she will make another one. I guess they did not have a pen or paper on hand to write all our orders in but I think in the future its okay to write it down and not have to worry about remembering all the orders being requested. 
As a All you Can Eat this is the sushi place to go. We haven't ventured out to any other places yet while visiting Las Vegas.

Was not expecting to find my husband's favorite AYCE sushi in a second, convenient location! I've been several times now and it's improving everytime.  

Only complaint: they leave two seats unavailable at the sushi bar for orders to be picked up - it makes more sense to move those to the side, leaving open to more seats!

Even though the food is good, I'd give 5 stars for staff alone! (I'd give more if I could as they are awesome!) Bedman is a superior stand out! XOXO!

Tasteless. Always messed with the order and have cheap quality of fishes. This place is closer to my work so I've decided to place the order for Togo but it has been twice already they forgot my orders. They Always made mistakes.

Service is great. Mulan and Killer were awesome. So I guess it's really up to how you expect to be treated. This is a AYCE and service like this is much better than a lot of full service restaurants I have been to. Food were great and fresh. Perhaps I am an easy-eater but I have had bad sushi before so I can't complain. So far, this is the best Japanese AYCE I have ever ever ever been to. This place is a must go to whenever I am in town. Keep it up Yama!!!!!!
Great food great service I come here frequently. The all you can eat is a great deal I always leave with a big smile

My favorite ayce sushi spot Seafood Salad is a must ! Son of the beach is also great. Only complaint at this location was the size of the rolls. A lot smaller than the original location, not sure why they are making their rolls so small. Hamachi Kama and Salmon Kama are both excellent too. Pistachio ice cream very light not too sweet, works out great with sushi.

My favorite AYCE sushi spot has opened a second location on the west side in China Town! I love the spacious, open restaurant. The other Yama location is soo packed that I always feel claustrophobic there. This location is bright, airy, and modern. I really enjoyed that aspect. The menu is the exact same and I even recognized some of the same sushi chef's from the other store. However, a lot of the food was different to me. The ponzu sauce on the seafood salad, for example, tasted different. Not as citrus-y. The rolls appeared to be cut smaller as well. For this reason, we ordered 2x the amount of rolls than we normally would. Pricing for lunch is $21.95 and dinner is $23.95 which is extremely reasonable! 

I love that it's AYCE and you can get anything on the menu. First time there? I gotchu. Start with a seafood salad either mild or hot if you like spice. Then if you're into apps, the sesame chicken is good, as well as the tempura shrimp.  Then, bring on the rolls. My favorites are:

Happy Rainbow
Sun Of The Beach
Wet Dream
No Name
Ellen Roll
Harry Potter

Many of these rolls are very saucy which is what I like. If you don't like saucy rolls, move on! My dining partner who had never eaten sushi before LOVED this place and cannot wait to go back. And we will be back.

Showed up and got seated right away even though we were waiting for people in our party to show up, which was really nice! Especially since it's cold outside and we didn't want to be sitting by the door waiting! The rolls were great! There were a few favorites we had - Sun on the beach, wet dream, and no name roll. I love how you can order half rolls! 

The only complaints I had about the restaurant - I asked the guy dropping off our drinks what the price for AYCE was and he said he didn't know and he'd find out. I feel like that is pretty basic information for a sushi restaurant. Before someone got back to us we had already found the price ourself on the menu. I ordered some nigiri, and I was wondering why it took so long. Then I got excited because I saw it finally coming and they put it down at another table that got seated after me. Then I realized, they forgot my order. When I reordered it wasn't too long before they brought my order over. The dessert menu is tiny. They only have 6 things. 3 different flavors of mochi, and 3 different flavors of ice cream. My friends didn't like the texture of the green tea ice cream. I enjoyed the strawberry mochi and the pistachio ice cream. The parking wasn't the greatest. I was able to find a spot, but they weren't extremely busy. I could see it being a problem on busy nights. 

When it's your birthday, which it was for the table next to us, they play the birthday song through loud speakers throughout the entire restaurant. This is good for a sushi restaurant. Usually they don't make a big deal about birthdays. I'm not sure if it was a trick candle, or if the lady was just older, but it took her about 6 tries to blow out the candle they gave her. So be ready! 

All in all the food was good quality, and I love how you can order half rolls! The garlic tuna and salmon were good! Also, it is the next morning so it's safe to say, no food poisoning. It's good to be able to trust a sushi restaurant! I'd go again for that sun on the beach roll!

This place replaced my favorite sushi spot (Doh) went in with high hopes and an empty stomach....

They were still remodeling from Doh's original setting so ambiance was a little ... Unorganized which is understandable. I love that they kept the bookshelfs, very homey feeling...

We went for my birthday dinner around 7pm, party of...5 adults and my 5 y.o son.   The place looked pretty empty so We were seated immediately.  Servers were nice and attentive for the most part.  When we eat sushi we always do AYCE, so we ordered quite a bit.  Rolls started coming in pretty quick.  They were Good, but nothing to rant about...I was mostly excited to try the Baked Mussels (these are one of my favorite dishes when i go out to eat sushi/seafood)... And I must say when they arrived, they looked good.  But after tasting them , I was sadly let down, the excessive amount of sirracha on top was just unnecessary.. To put it simply, i didn't like it.  

I'm also going to say, beware of their spice meter, (little chili emojis in their menu) we ordered a roll that had a level one spice and it literally was like fire in our mouths.  While another roll that was level three spice tasted like nothing.  

All in all, would come here again, only
Because it's decent sushi.  But it's no longer my favorite sushi spot....

Great sushi place, enjoyed rolls specially speciality rolls like Volcano and Spicy tuna, can get little crowded during peak times. Staff friendly but super busy and  kinda rush you for ordering, decently clean!
Minion & Sandy are Awesome servers...Very friendly & helpful w/menu selection...They're both an Assets to your restaurant...

Everything came out fast. We all did the all you can eat sushi. I was wrong to order the spicy tuna roll cause it left my mouth on fire and I ended up drinking four cups of water . All in all, a great restaurant, awesome menu and besides the AYCE choice the menu had reasonable prices. 
We had the Mochi ice cream for dessert, my favorite! That just topped it off. 

Highly recommend going here. The waitress warmed me about the spicy tuna bring too hot but I thought I could handle it. Haha. I was very wrong. So make sure you check pepper symbols listed on the menu, it's accurate.

The nigiri was great. The food was overall good but the service is what killed it for me. Took 15 minutes for our server to take our order. Multiple times, other servers passed us but we're never acknowledged. Good place but I won't be recommending it.

This place is a place I go to when when everything else isn't open. As soon as we got to the establishment, it took us 7 minutes to get seated. 
7 minutes standing with just another couple behind us. 

The food here is alright, it's almost like eating the same thing. My favorite thing to order here is the "Wet Dream" and "Hamachi Kama". I used to enjoy going here but as I widened my view of sushi, this place is mediocre.

Looking around, one thing that really surprised me was the decoration. I was surprised to see that the overall look of the place certainly did not match the whole- sushi aspect- of this sushi restaurant. There were bookshelves and it almost seemed as if this restaurant was first deemed to become a cafe of some sort. Just a random observation.

However, the food and service were fair (or maybe less than that)

At the every end, they do offer ice cream and mochi. We got our mochi and it was already melted as well as our ice cream.

We had an amazing experience tonight! Lester has amazing suggestions and knows the menu inside and out. I love sushi, but not seafood and he was able to make accommodations so that I had an array of options. He was delightful and for him alone if not for the superb sushi, we will be regulars!

Great value for the all you can eat sushi. A large variety of rolls and the nagiri sushi is awesome. Cool atmosphere and the staff is very friendly and attentive. I will eat here whenever I am in Vegas.

We are what some would call more than regulars at Yama sushi. We've been going to same location on flamingo for over 7 years. So when we found out another location was opening we were super excited about it and couldn't wait to try.
When we arrived to the Plaza it is located in, I was extremely disappointed in the availability for parking. There was absolutely no parking whatsoever. I know it's China Town and it usually always busy but dang. 
Once we entered I was pleased to find that waiting area was so spacious compared to the original location. The original has a bench inside that seats maybe 5 people and some benches outside. Anyways very pleased with the waiting area. As I walked in I was also pleased to find how big and spacious the entire restaurant was. I'm used to being elbow to elbow. Here however was very roomy. I was also so so happy to see booths. 
The waiters were very nice and prompt as always. And the food was great. Which I was hoping it would be. And so it was. I just wish that they had like a sushi bar in the middle of the room since they have room to do that. 
This location overall is pretty great but again the parking sucks balls! I'd come back with friends. But maybe carpool.

I went to Yama last night. We were seated right away, and the overall experience was okay. The food came out in a timely fashion. The servers would forget what we asked them at times, but they came by so often that it didn't matter. Everything seemed until we got home. My friend became extremely sick later in the night. I thought nothing of it until i felt the same exact way a few hours later. I will most definitely not be coming back. I can usually give a place a second chance, but not when it has made us extremely sick.

First of all, I don't know why my review from Doh (the old sushi place before Yama came in) got transferred over to Yama Sushi's review. That's not fair for them!

But I finally got to try out this new additional location for Yama Sushi. As usual I've ordered my usual favorites:

TNT, Firecracker, No Name and Happy Ending. Of course, the Seafood Salad.

As I was going through the menu, I noticed that there are some new rolls on there. Like Trust Me Baby, Fish and Chips and You the Man Too! They are new, right? I must haven't been paying attention to the original location's menu. Ha

Service is the same, still attentive and caring. But what knocks it down from a 4* to a 3*? It no longer has that home-y feel. The mom and pop store ambiance. It's commercialized or feels like a franchise. 

I'd def come back but to the original location on Flamingo and Maryland Pkwy.

Their all-you-can-eat deal is amazing. The sushi is so tender and melts in your mouth. We went there for my fiancee's birthday. It was amazing how they played happy Birthday over the speakers when they get him his ice cream. Everyone was so helpful and nice especially a server named Mulan. What fun!

The service here is phenomenal! Checked this place out with my girlfriends we were craving sushi on a Monday late night we arrived around 12:30 am and this sushi spot was open until 2:30 am. Since we arrived they greeted us and made us feel welcomed not only the service but the sushi was great! They have a huge selection of sushi dishes and appetizers included with the AYCE  the price for the dinner was I believe 24.99 not bad at all. l will definitely be back due to the great attentive service

My family and I loved coming here until our last visit. The 4 of us were basically seated and forgotten. We only ordered from the AYCEM twice because it took so long for anyone to come take our order. We watched as 2 parties that were seated after us were able to eat, pay and leave before anyone came over for us to order anything else. We finally gave up and had to ask the hostess to find out who our waiter was and get our check. Even then it took forever to get our check and when we let them know that the wait for any form of service was ridiculous there was no resolution, the explanation was that they were down a waiter, so why seat us if there's not enough staff? Unfortunate experience here because the value is  great for the sushi you get! We won't be coming back or recommending this place any more.
Always go here every other week. A+ for good service  and great food. The servers are very attentive. All servers go around and serve everybody well. So please tip good.

I love this place. The Wet Dream roll is by far, the best roll. This location seems a bit bigger and nicer. It's a great price for ayce. Make sure you order a few rolls at once, especially if they're baked because it takes a while to get them. I'm glad they finally opened a second location because it was always super packed with really long wait times. Definitely worth going to.

Update, I've called back every day asking for a manager, I'm STILL horribly sick BTW, and still no manager there, they take down my #_ no one ever calls me back. I'll be reporting this company to channel 13 news

Best sushi in Vegas in my opinion, Enjoyed the new second location.  It's as good as the first.  Also enjoyed finding out you can order half rolls so you can try different rolls all for a great price.  They were quick and very friendly.
I'm SO HAPPY they finally expanded! This location is so nice. AYCE for about $25. Harry Potter Roll and Wet Dream Roll ALL DAY.

It's been a while Yama! I haven't been to Yama on Maryland bc it's too far of a drive for me, then my sister told me they put up a second location in Chinatown. This place is a lot more spacious but it looks like they're in the middle of redecorating. 

The food is great, same as the original location. I noticed they've added a few new specials & now have takoyaki! O.M.G. I've been craving takoyaki so much & I'm glad I found an AYCE spot that has it.

1 star deducted for the service. Our server was attentive at first but as it got more busy the service dwindled.

I'd still come back. Yama is one of the few AYCE places I go to anyway.

All you can eat sushi. There are two of them... one on the east side (Flamingo), which is always crowded... and this one on Spring Mountain.
I like this place better just because it's more open and tables are not too close to each other. The wait staff is very helpful and all smiles. 
The sushi I order reflects my taste as I rarely order any type of roll. The food is good and when you order, comes out quickly. Fish is fresh, rice not too big...
Price is affordable considering the type of food you're getting.... I will be back soon

Favorite sushi place I have ever been anywhere!!! The service is unbelievable!!! They were packed but so attentive! Sushi all you can eat and they were fast. They brought roll after roll and were quick to help with suggestions. This was our first visit here and they brought us a gift. I can't say enough great things about this place!!!!
Love this place and super glad there is one closer to me now!

Really great food fast service. The all you can eat has a wide variety of options it's totally worth the price. It also includes dessert. I got the crazy roll it was amazing. The tempura udon soup is really good too.

Very poor organization, terrible customer service.  Charge for not eating rice!  Sushimi wasn't very fresh!  Very expensive.  Charge for not eating everything on your plate!  Crazy.  Had to go out to eat after this place.

All you can sushi? Not really all you can eat I guess. 
Waitress took our order of uni but the lady didn't come back to inform us we won't be getting it. Wasted thirty minutes in a 2hr minimum all you can eat sushi...

We just got done eating here with my family and when we got home, my mom, wife, brother and sister all got a stomach ache and diarrhea. I've never felt this way after eating sushi but this was the first time and it was very painful. I am never eating here again. I ate at the other location on east flamingo many times and never gotten sick once. I am sticking to Umiya, Sushimon, and Goyemon.

This is my favorite AYCE spot in Chinatown because they have the best SEAFOOD SALAD. The best kept secret for sushi lovers!!! I live for nigiri and it is great quality. The service is fast and the staff is very friendly. Thank you to the fantastic sushi chefs for preparing yummy food! 

You guys never disappoint. And I love that this is the 2nd location.

Service was horrible at first, our server with the name tag "im a killer" was rude. She was tapping her pen trying to make us hurry up & order. Then when i asked a simple question about the menu she replied by nodding & rolling her eyes. I work in the restaurant business and understand that when it gets busy things can get hectic, but as a server its part of your job to hold it together in front of the guests.

We then asked a server with a name tag "Bruce Lee" to change servers. "Bruce Lee" asked why and we explained then told us to go to him if we needed anything. The service started getting better since we didnt have to deal with "im a killer". Food came and it was GREAT!! Amazing sushi! We will definitely go back for the food but with hopes that certain people can pull together a smile and help make our stay more enjoyable

I give it 3 stars because of the good service. But the food wasn't good. We tried the one on Maryland then got sick. I told myself to give this place a chance. Yup, same thing happened, we got sick again! I guess you get what you paid for ($23.95 is pretty cheap for AYCE sushi in town)

Sushi itself was good. The reason I'm giving a 1 star is because of the . When ordering the uni, it said one order per person on the menu. When our waitress was explaining it us it sounded like one order per person per round. After we finished our first round we put in an order for a second round. Our waitress then disappeared for an hour. So we asked the bus boy if he could check on our order. The manager comes to our table and tells us the one order person is for the entirety of the dinner. I asked how we were able to get multiple orders of other items that were one order per person. He then proceeded to give me the run around. I also told him that we had ordered a round of giant clams and it hasn't come out and we've been waiting for 40 mins since our waitress disappeared. He offered to bring them out but I was so over with my experience there that I told him it was okay we we're already full. Definitely will not repeat.

Great place to eat sushi, love it . Great customer service, it was worth it. Im coming there again. That Guy name Taiedo Max or something did great . He was working hard, hopefully he can help me out with his service . Great job boss

AMAZING!!! Best AYCE in town! This place has so many great thing to brag about. Let's start with the awesome atmosphere and upbeat-fun music selection. The staff is very friendly, and if you can sit in LESTER's section, DO IT! He is the ultimate guide for all things DELICIOUS! He helped point out some menu items we otherwise would of overlooked. We tried several appetizer selections (the Green Mussels are our FAV!!), as well as sushi rolls. Hands down the "Man Whore" & "Special Yobo Roll" are some of the BEST! I could go on and on. We ended with pistachio &  red bean ice cream. I added a mango Mochi ice cream last min. Lester surprised us with this awesome display (see pic). Yama Sushi is definitely worth every penny and will be one of our go-to spots from now on. One more thing...Try the fresh wasabi!!!! (another delicious tip from Lester)

The sushi is poorly wrapped. They arent nearly as good as yama sushi1 (flamingo and maryland). They brought us the wrong order then told us later that they forgot to make the order. We asked someone after 20 minutes about the order, he said he'd check, another 15 minutes late and nothing. Very disappointed.
My favorite sushi !! Device is good and the fish is always fresh. I love the roll baby one more time! I come here for every special occasion

I'm assuming they had a change of management because the name has changed. They removed a couple different items from the old menu. One thing we were disappointed with was the yakitori, it was over cooked, as in it was hard to chew and the flavor was bland. Also, they took out our favorite dessert, banana dream and left us with a choice of mochi and ice cream. However, their service is still friendly! It doesn't compare to Doh Sushi!

I was with a group of five and normally would steer clear of a sushi place that has a three star rating on Yelp. Everyone wanted sushi, there was a line at the door and the restaurant smelled great.

So glad we found this gem. Two of us got the unlimited sushi. $23.95 and you can pick anything off the menu. You can also choose to get half rolls so that you can try more without wasting food. You can also pick from the appetizer and/or dessert menu.  

So..so...so GOOD. Fresh fish, delicious sauce and incredibly patient and friendly staff.

Sushi is always a hit or miss for me, and this time it was a hit. Sushi tasted wonderful, but the service was horrendous, which unfortunately is why I'm giving this establishment a 3 star rating. I sat at the bar and didn't get any drink service until I was eating my last roll... No water and I had to ask twice for wasabi and ginger.... Slow waiting staff but excellent sushi.

Love it! 
Great service, great food, decent prices. 
Highly recommended! 
I will defiantly come back here and will be happy and comfortable to bring friends over.

I used to go to Yama sushi on flamingo and it was great food, just long waits in line. So my wife and I decided to try the spring mountain location for lunch. At first we thought it was great, and then we began to notice that it was not fresh fish. We both ordered seafood salad which is supposed to have assorted fish but they gave us 1 type of fish. I'm assuming they were trying to get rid of a certain type of fish to prevent waste. They also did it with my rainbow roll, I didn't see any tuna on the roll. Afterwards my wife and I spent some time in the bathroom, diarrhea trips for the rest of the day for both of us..... Never again will I eat at either Yama. I'm going back to my trusty sushi restaurant that never failed me with long waits or old fish.

Originally before Yama Sushi took over this place used to be Doh Sushi. I haven't been to this Yama Sushi location, but have been to their other location on Maryland and Flamingo plenty of times while going to UNLV. This location is a lot bigger than its other location, but I've heard they expanded. 

The service here was great. It seemed like the servers were constantly available as multiple servers floated around taking orders, bringing out the food, and refilling drinks within different table sections. The food was brought to our table not too long after we ordered. There is nothing worse than waiting for the food to come out when you're on your "eating flow." 

The All You Can Eat (AYCE) menu seems to be similar from what I can remember at the other location. They also have a separate menu for those doing a la carte, which one of my three friends did. Among the things we ordered some of them were: baked green mussels, takoyaki, different types of nigiri, the Wet Dream Roll (one of my favorites), the Double Dragon Roll, and mochi ice cream. The rice to fish ratio is good to where the rice doesn't take the bulk of the sushi piece.

I wish they had a larger dessert menu. Ice cream and mochi ice cream is what I usually get, but it's nice to have other options just in case I want to try something else. Overall, I'd say it's a good place to go to.

This used to be Doh, one of our favorite places to eat in town. Compared to Doh, They removed a lot of the Korean dishes, but have improved the sushi selection. The price was lowered by $2. We like this place, but we miss Doh. Open late, 2am if I remember right.

I went here for dinner before a school dance. I made no reservations but seats were available within 3 minutes of my arrival. I was even able to get the nice seats at a booth. The sushi was good. The nigiri tasted nice and fresh. The baked rolls were delicious and warm. The rolls with salmon were particularly my favorite. I did the AYCE and it was very much worth the price. It was very fulfilling with the good variety of sushi. For desert, I was able to choose a scoop of ice cream, and one mochi ice cream, among other deserts. All were cold and refreshing. The plum wine ice cream was very good and tasted similar to cotton candy. The mochi was great too. The waiters were kind and almost always ready to take empty dishes away. On this particular day, however, the restaurant was not busy very much. Overall, a very nice and delicious dining experience.

I've been to the Yama that's been on Flamingo and Maryland since even before it expanded and I've always been a fan. The sushi chefs are great, the food always tastes fresh, and everything in AYCE comes out in a timely manner. 

This new Yama on Spring Mountain is also just as good. More spacious than the other Yama (I believe it used to be Doh sushi and tapas? I remember the set up being very similar), but with the same good sushi chefs and fish :) the menu is the same as the old one, but I felt that this one had a lot of character as far as the servers (cool names btw)! The Servers were very attentive asking if we needed anything and how things were AND they didn't rush us when ordering food. The food that we ordered came out SUPER QUICK. The appetizers actually did come first, which is  different because they normally take longer because they're fried, and then alllll the rolls and nigiri we ordered came together. (granted, we always order a lot up front because they take a while, but this place was on point). 

(However, the only bad part about everything coming at once and then ordering more at different times is that things tend to get lost. My friend order 3 more items, all of which did not get to us by the time we decided to get the bill and dessert. )

I would definitely come back just based on the sushi and the service (just make sure to keep track of your orders!), and now I might always go to this location for the speed :)

For the price, what you get is pretty awesome. After I got sick of sushi, I went onto bbq ribs and sesame chicken and salad. I appreciate the awesome variety! I wasn't particularly impressed with the tempura and miso soup though,  and I love tempura and miso soup so I was a little sad on that end. The batter seems to suck up oil or something. The temperature of their fryer is probably off, but no big deal because there was so much other stuff to eat!

Great quality all you you can eat Japanese food!

Probably the best sushi joint I've ever been to. The wait can be a bit long but it's totally worth it.

Good parking too!

I was never really into sushi, but after eating here, I'm a sushi fan now.  We kinda stumbled on to this place looking for a seafood restaurant.
I can't remember all the names of the sushi rolls we ate, I know it was eel, salmon, tuna and it was all really good.  I think it was all you can eat for about $23, and it was well worth it.  Next time I'm in Vegas, no doubt I'm coming here again!!

This area is one of the hardest to get parking but it's worth it. Me and my friends came here on a Saturday night to grab some food before a movie. Me and another Nicole came in and put our name down while we waited for our other friends to show up and find parking.. It took them forever but I understand why!! It's so hard! We got seated and while waiting for them got a drink order in and they finally came in. We got to look at the menu for a while and the the waitress came over and took our order. I wasn't really the hungry so I only got one dragon roll and one of my other friends doesn't really care for sushi so she just got some fried rice. My other two friends got the all you can eat menu which also can include fries, fried rice and some other random things. It cost an extra dollar per roll for soy paper. But I really love it when places are okay when not all the table is all you can eat. I know people probably think they are going to share the food or something but it doesn't always work out that way. We got our food really fast and it was delicious. They have all kinds of unique rolls. One of the ones I remember was the Harry Potter roll. It didn't have much to do with Mr. Potter but it was a unique name. Before finished we ordered mochi and ice cream which was the perfect ending to out meal. I ordered green tea ice cream and strawberry mochi and they only charged me for one. It was really nice of them.

Yama Sushi is an AYCE sushi restaurant, though you can also order a la carte...But by the time you order a couple of dishes from menu you may find out you are better with the AYCE pricing: $20.95 for lunch and $23.95 for dinner. The set price seems to be the way to go here. 

Located in the very heart of Spring Mountain, Yama brings in a lot of foot traffic, so it can be quite busy here. For the record, it is not my typical choice for sushi, but it was already chosen by a good friend of mine.  The inside of Yama is very clean, even the air was absent of any fishy odor, which is often the signal for me to leave, without looking back...but on this day, you guessed it, I stayed.

While my guest ordered many different rolls and enjoyed them very much, I ordered Nigiri Sushi. I am not a fan of rolls in general, especially those drizzled with sauce, so I have nothing to say about the rolls here, I simply avoided them. As is often the case, some items are restricted to only one order per person, such as Uni, Sweet Shrimp, Giant Clam, etc.

A typical issue with AYCE Sushi restaurants is that they want you to fill up fast...they put too much rice on their rolls and Nigiri...not at Yama Sushi. Perfect amount for each bite!! 

The service was attentive and friendly. They don't rush you, but they are not slow to take your order either.

So, if you need a spot for AYCE and want the option of rolls, nigiri, and sashimi, this might not be a bad option for you.

- 2017 Review #62 -

Great food but horrible services. Only good employee was Carlos aka sexy daddy. He isn't even a waiter. The waiter kept forgetting our order and brought wrong orders. They need better waiters. Hopefully they have better services.

Got to experience the buffet! Great price for sushi. The servers are very helpful when you can't decide which roll to try next. They have fun character names! Only thing I don't like is the price for kids to have the buffet.
The biggest selection of rolls I've ever seen. A little repetitive but still a must try for a very affordable all you can eat price. if you ever in Vegas,  definitely should come to HAMA.

A friend and I were checking out Chinatown and pulled in to a parking lot.  We drove around looking for a place for lunch.  We saw Thai, Chinese, Vietnamese, and Japanese.  We decided to walk in to Yama Sushi not knowing what's behind those glass doors.  We were greeted warmly and seated right away.  This was around 1:30pm and there were still a lot of people eating.  The place was not too noisy and clean.

Not much of a sushi person, we each ordered a bento box.  For less than $9.00, we got miso soup, salad, rice with salmon and Korean bbq.  They were outstanding and fresh.  We also ordered spider roll for appetizer and it was so delish.

Service was excellent.  Waitresses checked on us often and hot tea was poured consistently.  The ambiance was great and we will definitely come back and try AYCE next time.  We will definitely bring out-of-town guests to this place.  Very presentable place.

My cousin and I were super hungry from our 6 hour hike so decided to get AYCE sushi at Yama. Thinking it would live up to its sister over on flamingo, I was hyped. 

Walking in, the place was big compared to a lot of the sushi places in town. Probably could fit twice the amount of people. 

One of the workers was mopping which already gave me a bad vibe. Don't you usually mop before you open or after you close? It had a strong smell of bleach, which I am not fond of, especially while trying to eat. 

Service was great! Water was refilled quite quickly, food was served pretty fast, and the ladies were always checking up on us, asking if we needed anything. 

First up, some nigiri. Ordered the super white, yellowtail, eel, salmon, and albacore. Like another reviewer said, the rice was definitely not sushi rice. I usually order a ton of nigiri but these just were not cutting it. Slices were a bit more chewy than normal and if it came with a sauce underneath the rice, it over saturated it. 

Second up, Uni. Now I've had some good and bad Uni and these were on the border. For me, I think Uni has a creamy texture with a buttery finish. These had a watery creamy texture with a fishy finish. 

We also got the baked green mussels which had their version of a vinegar based sauce on it which were ok. 

The best thing we ordered were the kalbi or short ribs. Can't really go wrong or mess those up. 

I don't think I'll be coming back here.
The sushi is fresh and if you are hungry and ready to eat then get the all you can order!! It hit the spot after a few days of dessert high winds and non-sleepless nights.

So I was very hungry and going somewhere else to eat.  Then I saw the AYCE and sushi sign and changed the plan.  Went in, seated immediately.  Great variety of choices. Ordered 3 of my favorite things, had them within 5 minutes.  Got another roll I saw on the neighbors table (kind of nice to have neighbors to get ideas from; the tables are pretty close together).  Yum!  Just one more.  Yum!  The salmon was buttery.  The shrimp tempura was perfect.  The eel/unagi was yummy.  Only $20!  OMG!  I'm moving to Vegas just so I can eat here every week. (not really).  Clean.  Sweet staff.  Fresh and delish.

A party of 9 for a friend's surprised birthday dinner went well. All you can eat for $ 24-30. All the baked sushis would take a while so I suggest getting them first. Wet Dream is my favourite then second would be the Man Whore. Enjoyed the whole dinner with staff singing happy birthday with a cute mochi ice cream dish. This place never disappoints me.

I cant believe Sushi Doh got bought out and turned into Sushi Yama. I had to take down my 5 star review since my first and last visit to this new place was really bad. 
Sushi Doh was my favorite sushi spot in Vegas. I brought so many people here and they all loved it.

I finally visited the new Sushi Yama and i couldnt believe it.... they took out all the good dishes that i used to come here for.
I had some spicy tuna to keep it simple. 3 rolls for $30 later... i walked away disguisted and with two days worth of having the runs. 
Lets just say that i will never go back there.
Hopefully Sushi Doh will reopen sometime soon. Ill have to start searching for a new sushi spot

The worst sushi all you can eat ever! I didnt expect much from beginning but .. all the plates has hot sauce ... nigiri .... why it needs hot sauce... beer was good because it made from beer company ice ream was ok too because its from ice ream company

Cleaner and better service than the original Yama. The food was the same good quality so far, during the three times we've eaten at this new location. Reservations are not necessary at this time. This new location is more spacious for larger groups as well.

Have been to both locations now, love this one! So beautiful inside! Staff was friendly and patient, attentive and although they were extremely busy, they still made time for our group of 4. We always do All You Can Eat and it's definitely worth it!

Yama has really good sushi but poor customer service. I have been sitting here for more than 45 minutes and counting with no food or even a waitress to ask us how we are. We didn't even get our trays for our soy sauce so we had to use our plates. :( Just now,  one of the newer ladies working here asked us if we wanted to order more... While I was in mid sentence she walked away. I told her we order a lot of food but I'd like to order more since we never got anything! Knowing that it was a busy night, I ordered all my food at once and still nothing.  This is terrible. I absolutely dislike the poor service here.

Late review but I love this place! Great fresh food , clean, relaxing atmosphere!  What more can you ask for? My favorite roll is the shrimp lovers and the smoked salmon. My husband loves the spicy tuna rolls and sweet shrimp.
Best ayce sushi service! The staff was very nice and easy going! Best servers Sugar love and Goofy!

Good place to eat sushi, I've been here multiple times and I like to order the seafood salad and a few times the fish isn't the freshest but besides that the food is pretty great. 
Service is good and fast.

I walked into the men's room and a sushi chef walked out without washing his hands. I told the manager but he did not tell the employee to wash his hands. Instead he said he was going to review the video recording.  Meanwhile the sushi chef continued to make rolls for people. "So some people got sushi rolles with his junk flavor all over the rolles" that was the final and last time. I'm done and so should you. Another time two of them were counting there money with the gloves they continued to make sushi with. This place has major health issues. Around feb. or march 2017.

Ivonne the hosttes is very sweet and helpful with the menu and customer satisfaction, it have to be a latina !!! Way to go ivonne i will comeback just to  have the pleasure to se a professional like her working again or just to say hello!!

I've been hearing so much hype about this place. It's ok, but way over-hyped. I came for lunch. No bells and whistle, like Toro, Uni, Salmon Belly, and they ran out of sweet shrimp (Amaebi) so I struck out there. The parking stinks in that plaza. Taste was ok, but nothing to write about to you Yelpers.

I came here on Sunday for a last hurrah before leaving LV and I had a wonderful experience. The service was amazing, food was great, true all you can eat with no gimmicks or catches.

I left feeling very satisfied with quality food at a reasonable price.

I wish this place existed in Los Angeles!!

I will be back next time I'm in Vegas :-)

So I've been to quite a few sushi joints and this is definitely my favorite. The service is great everyone is really friendly and attentive. The fish is always fresh and they have a great selection of rolls. The vegetable tempura is amazing. Definitely recommend trying this place.

I've been to the other Yama Sushi location before, and decided to come to this one (closer to my house) when my mom came to visit. Neither of us had had lunch, so we were starving and chose AYCE sushi for dinner. We came at prime dinnertime, and had to park a few streets over, but the wait was only about 15 minutes before we were seated.

Service was variable. Initially, servers were very attentive and refilled waters and took orders, but later on during our meal, we had to work a little to flag people down. Nonetheless, the service provided was fine, and you don't really get assigned a single waiter/waitress.

The menu is fairly extensive and everything is included in AYCE (except some items can only be ordered once). I like the variety of items here, between appetizers, nigiri, and rolls. The quality was decent for all you can eat, and price around $25 per person for dinner.

The interior is sleek and fairly nice, though it is not huge so it can get busy and is fairly noisy.

Overall, there are so many AYCE sushi places to choose from in town, and Yama Sushi is a solid offering.
I love coming here for a late night sushi date with my friends. They have an amazing selection to choose from. The scenery is great and the customer service to match!
The sushi was solid, the overall service was great, they were always asking if we wanted to order more. Would go back again.

This is an awesome sushi place in Las Vegas! I think there is another location not too far from this one, maybe just as good. Anyway, the food is great! The freshest fish I've had in Vegas in a while. This might be my new favorite sushi place in Vegas. It's all you can eat, and the prices are unbelievably good!

Place is awesome, great service, great chefs, friendly service. For the food quality the price is pretty cheap. Love that lobster popcorn and dragon roll my fav anyways try this place and bring that apatite.

Me and my friends came there on a Sunday night around 9pm. Surprisingly it wasn't crowded. It was my first time going there, our waitress was very lovely and attentive!! Forgot to ask for her name  but she has a high ponytail curled. We ordered a lot of good food!!! And the one thing that amazed me most was their uni ( sea urchin ). It was sooooo tasty, sweet and buttery. Best uni I've ever had!! I tried uni over Oyshi and it was not good. I'll be coming back tomorrow with my friend for that uni! I would've given them 5 stars but the nigiri they made was a little sloppy, broken fishes, but it came out really fast though. I ordered some unagi and it has too much fat, the cut was uneven also. But overall, the quality is good, service is awesome!

The best sushi spot in town. Everything here is good, amazing and delicious. I have been here at least over 10 times and EVERY time I visit its a 5/5 star experience. The waiters are super courteous, nice, and friendly. Sushi is pure and fresh. My favorite is the green mussels.

Yama sushi was ok. The servers were super friendly and efficient, they stopped by many times asking if I'd like to order more for ayce. The fish wasn't old but it didn't have much flavor at all. As well as a small appetizer list. This was my first time trying Yama sushi at this location. AYCE was $23.95.

This is my favorite all you can eat sushi restaurant, but lately this place has been slacking in customer service. My sister and I went on Thursday May 10th and it was packed (which it usually is) but we got there told the lady that seats people for two she said ok it's a 25-30 min wait so we were fine because that is the usual wait time. We waited 35 min passed a couple came in said for two and got seated immediately in a booth so we were like ok that's odd I went up told the lady "hey we've been waiting for a while" I told her my name she said oh no one wrote it down let me go get you a table ok so we were waiting again 20 more min passed another couple comes in gets seated at a table immediately I go back up and ask her "hey what's going on we've been waiting her for like an hour already waiting" again she tells me no one took your name down so we didn't know I was like ok well can you write it down now she says hey there is chairs at the bar would you like to go I say no so she goes looks for a table and comes back and says has anyone helped you yet I say yes you just went to go look for a table for me she goes oh well the bar is free I say no again and she said oh wait we have a table ready then we finally get seated we get ice water it tastes like dish soap it was so gross but we ate
Fast service! A lot of different choice of food!  Great price for sushi. All sushi are fresh!
