the last time I visited this place the food made me sick we had stomach pain my family and me :(

This is my favorite spot to eat sushi! It's so delicious my husband and I always come here. Customer service is always excellent the sushi is always fresh. I love that is open until 2am so that means we can stop by at anytime lol

Love Yama sushi ! This location is much more spacious then the one on flamingo and was defiantly a plus. I will have to agree with some of the other reviews that the service was just ok, I wish I had gotten the gentleman's name that made the service ok . He was wonderful and personable as the ladies left me wondering if my food was coming and if my bill was going to be settled as it took a long time for them to bring it . The food however was great as always and I will return to this location and would still recommend this as one of the best ayce places around !

If you are one of those people who loves sushi so much, THIS IS YOUR TO GO PLACE!! They have AYCE lunch at 12P.M- 3P.M and dinner at 3P.M- 2:30A.M. This place is usually packed at night time. Customer service is excellent. Food quality is really good. I recommend coming here with your date!

I likes it. I likes it a lot. 

Great place located in Las Vegas' China Town. Clean and good service. Ask for MagicMike. He makes a killer SpiderRoll. 

We plan on returning! Take advantage of the "All you can eat sushi" special for $23 bucks!

I really like the location on the east side of town, but it's farther, smaller, and there's always a wait.

I was super stoked when they opened this location, so of course I wanted to go here for my birthday dinner!

The price is still reasonable, menu is the same (although some items tasted a little different), service was good, and ambience was nice!

I'd definitely come back to this location next time I'm craving AYCE sushi.

Since this now became Yama Sushi II it now has the quality  that we can expect from the other location on Maryland and Flamingo!  Friendly  staff, outstanding food. FRESH.  GREAT SUSHI.  great price.  All you can eat.  Do not let the other reviews scare you that is from the other sushi place that was in the same location!  

Additional information!  No long wait like tge other location.  Plenty  of seating.  !
Great food and the staff is friendly and care about the customers. We were checked on by 3-4 diff waiters other than ours
Very excellent sushi prince sushi bar nice services fish very fresh salmon skin hand rolls nigiri like this place I will come back again thanks

Good spot for all u can eat. The sushi is good quality and comes to your table really fast. The servers are really attentive to all your needs. Definitely check this place out when u get a chance. I've yet to leave this place unsatisfied. Keep up the good work guys!
Yama Sushi is great. Good food, great atmosphere, and the drinks are good. Will definitely be back for more.

Their food is only ok. Their menu is the same one as the Yama sushi next to unlv. It is nice that they open until 2:30 am. It is also busy at night. However, their service is slow and I think a lot of their staff is new. We sat there majority of the time waiting for someone to come by. There was a female employee just standing next to the register on her phone the whole time we were here while everyone else was running around.
Always have loved the sun of beach roll! Service could do better but overall the food is consistent. Although they didn't have uni, so they offered lobster in replacement.

I love the original and this 2nd restaurant is just as great!! 
My favorites include the Harry Potter and Wet Dream!

Out of the 6 AYCE sushi places I've tried in Vegas, Yama is still my favorite!

Yama has large varieties/big menu at a good price.

My favorite thing about Yama is that their appetizers beat all other sushi spots. Their soft shell crab is my absolute favorite! Sooo good. Sweet shrimp with deep fried head another favorite. Hamachi Kama, yuuuum. Must get all three of this every visit!

I love their nigiri as well, uni, salmon and masago with quail eggs are my absolute favorite to order. Their seafood here is fresh compared to some other places I've tried.

Defiantly my go to sushi spot
My friend got PARASITES after eating here a few days ago... safe to say all my friends and myself will never return here. Beware!!!

We stopped in for a last minute lunch on our way to the airport. AYCE sushi for $21 is a deal!
The quality of the sushi was just decent. Our server (didn't get his name) was super nice!

I really enjoyed the rolls. Quality was not comparable to that of what I have here at home (in Hawaii), but it was still good. We had about 6 rolls for our group of 4, 2 shrimp tempura and chicken yakitori. I can't remember all the names of the rolls, but we did get a few that were suggested from the waiter, such as "no name" which was my favorite. At the end, we got 1 mochi ice cream each and a scoop of regular (japanese flavored) ice cream. YAY for a great deal!

Service was exceptional. There wasn't a lot of people in the restaurant while we were there, and our waiter was able to refill our drinks and check on us multiple times. Whenever I go back to Vegas, I will be back for AYCE sushi. =)
great food , excellent chefs , but service is little bit lousy . i highly recommend this sushi place for excellent rolls andsashimi as well

This is the second location of the legendary Yama sushi which originally started on flamingo in the corner of Maryland Parkway. It is about six times the size of the original one. I have yet to be in here when it is packed yet the staff seems to struggle to keep up with demand. The original location is far superior to this one but they still offer a great service.

Damn solid sushi and nigiri got like so many fresh salmon nigiri and dragon rolls would eat this again if I come back to vegas and craving a lot of sushi which is very unlikely but I kinda was when I came down here no regrets and would give this another go. Oh and they also had poke lol so good. Price was 23.95 a person for dinner when I went not bad if you paying for quality food but def pricy for my standards

Never coming back! My Fiancé and I did not have a good experience. Our hot food orders came out cold and we waited 20min for two orders to come out. When we asked about them we keep getting from multiple people it's coming, to only find out the order was never put in. People here are rude and the food was very bland. Try at your own risk!!!!!!

YAMAAAAA!!! literally my reaction anytime someone asks me where I would go for AYCE sushi, I love this place! Their original location is on flamingo right by UNLV, and if you've been there you know how long the wait is due to how small the space is. This place is located in china town and the  space is so much bigger, and it's so nice! AYCE prices are very reasonable, and they have so much to offer on their menu! Always fresh, always tasty!

Meh! Decided to check out this new location to see if it's any good. 

First impression sucked w the staff. A friend had gotten a table first and my bf and I came in a couple minutes later. Waitress asked if we were ready and I said not yet. She said she'd be back but never came back. Had to try and flag someone down after 20minutes. It's like we were invisible in the area they sat us at which is once you enter the restaurant, all the way to the right in the corner. I'm not sure how many times I've waved my hand and the waitress just doesn't pass our table or just doesn't look over. 

Food was not that great. Rice had a strong vinegar taste to it, I think they went vinegar happy or something. The amount of rice in a hand roll was just absolutely ridiculous. There was so much rice, the roll became unenjoyable. We literally ate just the section w the fish/veggies along w some rice and there was still a good chunk of it left. The miso soup was sooooo salty. 

A few of our orders never made it to the table even though we mentioned it 2-3 times. 

All in all, will never come back here. It's lame. Crap service and food.

The waiting area is the size of a small bedroom. The hostess wont even walk outside to call customers names when they obviously know people are waiting outside for their name to be called. They just cross your name off the list if you're not inside the door when your name comes up.

The sushi quality is good and the prices are fair but the service is pretty bad (very slow, cultural/language barriers), the location is kinda sketchy and the restaurant smells fishy (which it shouldn't, despite the fact that they serve fish, the smell comes from a lack of cleaning). I wouldn't never have stopped here, let alone eat here, if it wasn't recommended by work friends. 

They take much longer than they tell you when you do pickups and only accept calls at EXACTLY 12noon - not a minute, not a second earlier.

Food was wonderful but the service left a lot to be desired. My husband never got his albacore tuna that we had to order twice. Waters were not refilled until we were ready to leave. The service here was not up to par when compared to the other Yama Sushi on Flamingo. I will not be eating here again.

The best ayce (all you can eat) sushi place in Vegas.  Extremely affordable at $23.95 per person for dinner.  My wife and I were in sushi heaven.  You can order anything off the menu, and the menu is extensive!  From appetizers to entrees to desserts, this place rocks!  We enjoyed the specialty rolls, bbq ribs (kalbi), unagi sushi, saba sushi, soft shell crab, amaebi, mochi ice cream, and everything we ate!  Make sure you eat all your sushi including the rice as they will charge you extra if you don't finish it!  My wife and all ate about $110 plus if we were to order off the menu at regular price.  Thanks for the yummy sushi and will definitely be back if we are in Vegas again!

I really really like this place and I always want to come here when i'm LV! I think their other location is better, but this one is just as good too. 

I enjoy their efficiency and accuracy when it comes to customer service and food. I could NOT believe how fast they were in delivering the food to our table. I love how the AYCE includes apps, and desserts! Love their offerings of short ribs, katsu, karaage, teriyaki, seafood salad, poke, etc. the list goes on!

My favorite sushi options are always something with unagi.  The MOST popular one is the "no name" which is #24. I see why everyone gets it. it is sooo flavorful and captures unagi with salmon and shrimp tempura. Mmmm. I also like their #34 Spicy Sexy Roll for their take on spicy sushi, and really, almost anything here is good. I just don't care for deep friend rolls.

Some rolls were smaller and not as detailed, like the philly roll and the unagi. I thought it still tasted fresh, not like a sushiland. But I think b/c they strive to be quick, the details get lost. Otherwise, pretty cheap for AYCE ~23.95 and for the most part, I think their sushi and appetizer offerings are really worth it! Now i'm getting hungry!

I was here in Las Vegas for a 3 day weekend trip. Yama deserves a 3 1/2 stars. This sushi buffet was ok. My friends like it.  I had better else well. I feel like the sushi is cut very thinly or small. There were a lot of rice on the sushi and rolls. I like the poke bowl & the mochi ice cream. And the items that were better, you can only order it one time. Would I come back here again, probably not. However, my friends said they would come back again. $23.99 per person.

This is one of the best all you eat sushi spots in town! The food was delicious and the tuna poki salad is to die for!

Came around 1 on a Saturday and it was PACKED. However, the wait was only 10 minutes.

Only complaint i have is that they need more staff. We waited for our server for 10 mins when we were first seated and could barely get her to come to the table throughout our meal. 

Nevertheless, the food was delicious and we'll be back!

Btw, try the yama roll!

This is a great place for many people. they have a good selection of food. You can find raw rolls or deep fried rolls if you don't like raw fish. Every time I go I must eat "no name". You can get all you can eat sushi with an appetizer for $25 it's a great deal and you can easily eat more than $25 worth of sushi. You can also get an ice cream type thing that that is amazing. I personally suggest getting mango. The only downfall is that sometimes you can't really understand the waiters.
I love Yama. Customer service I always amazing. We just can't get enough of it. It's a place that we go back to all of the time. Highly recommend.

Yamasushi has yet to let me down.  Always good sushi and great service. They have a wide variety of dishes including my all time favorites:
SWEET SHRIMP WITH HEAD*
UNI*
IKURA WITH QUAIL EGGS

These items* are usually a dinner only option, but here, they serve it at lunch too! 

I will definitely come back to this location!

I am in shock this place doesn't have a line out the door and around the corner. The service is above and beyond quick friendly professional and spot on. 
The food is excellent quality flavor and menu variety is extensive. Sexy Grandpa nametag carries a smooth flawless operation and every single person is happy here. 
The place is clean good ambiance and you get seated right away. I was by myself and still got offered table or booth but chose the bar. Teletobi made sure I was never waiting for a plate. 
I had plates I would have never ordered at some sushi places..as they are not exactly sushi but but since here you can choose AYCE alternative all you can eat and it is not a buffet bar...it is AYCE plate by plate freshly made. I had the greatest seafood salad y Hamachi Kama. Be adventurous and try some plates. Read what is in it ....as you should not leave food uneaten.  Common courtesy to keep the good operation of the place. 
The value the experience the flavors of there were six stars  I would give it. This place at either of its two locations is a must. Spring mountain location closes 2am for late night bites while Flamingo location closes at 11pm.

Our first time coming since new owners took over for Doh Sushi and I am very disappointed. We used to come to Doh 3-4 times a month and absolutely loved the variety of items on the menu which included no rice rolls(Johnny Roll and Rock N Roll), the spicy garlic edamame, the Coco shrimp, butterfly roll and the lobster roll only to name a few of our favorites. Now all the rolls of the new menu Yama has, everything is drowned in spicy mayo and it's so overpowering! Even the chef's spicy garlic sauce tastes like a spicy mayo and over powering. The quality of the fish was not as good either... The salmon was chewy and they took sashimi off the menu because they don't have high grade fish.  I am totally disappointed and disgusted by so much mayo and all the spice that it almost made me sick. We don't plan on coming back here anytime soon.

This is hands down the best sushi place ever!!! A couple locals recommended this place and we took a chance. We showed up were seated right away, there were 8 of us. We happened to get there right before the rush as all you can eat was starting. One of the best things, other than the sushi, was that the menu had pictures of all the specialty sushi. It all was so good I ordered for pick up the next day. No Name and oh damn Harry and wet dream and super Cali were my favorite just to name a few. This is definitely a place we will go to our next Vegas visit.

It was my first time here and we came a few nights ago, i was craving sushi and this location closes around 2 and its perfect because I work til midnight. I loved the food and our waitress as well who recommended their top 3 rolls. great customer service from "I am not human" name tag and the rest of the waitress! the food came out quick and rolls tasted amazing. my favorite was the sun of the beach and wet dream! definetely the best ayce in vegas for me! will be back to bring my co workers, friends and family!
A much better location and ambiance than the original location. The best AYCE sushi deal in Vegas for the quality.

I decided to try the new location and was disappointed. The rolls here are mostly baked or deep fried and doesn't have as much variety as sushi kaya. My friend who is also vegetarian did not find any of her vegetable rolls fulfilling and lacked flavor. The decor is nice but we deff won't be returning here. The vegetable and vegan rolls were pretty much the same don't be fooled. I will give them 5 stars on their customer service just wish the food matched.

My favorite sushi place in Las Vegas! This is the newer location and more elegantly designed in my opinion. Service has NEVER been an issue. It's got a younger crowd feel at this location and is larger than the flamingo location. There sushi is the best hands down in Vegas. When I visit Vegas this place is a must visit!!!

We had family in town from Hawaii and they wanted something different from the regular casino buffets. This place was a sure pleaser! They we're so amazed at the quality of the food and we all left with very full belly's.

Wow we loved this place! Wanted to try something off the strip and we're glad we did! We sat at the sushi bar and it was such a nice experience. Delicious food and fun atmosphere. We made friends with the sushi chef Jose, and he asked if he could make us something special and we're glad we let him. Overall a great dinner and at a very good price! We will be back!
Super friendly and patient staff.  The fish was fresh and they have gluten free soy sauce (Tamari) for those in your party who may be gluten free.

I used to be a regular at doh. It was pretty good. I always got the all you can eat and left satisfied! Their rolls were so delicious! Now that it's Yama..... Well.... It's still delicious but they need fresher ingredients! The avocados in the rolls were almost black. The rolls kept breaking apart... Ah.... And not to forget..... THEY DO NOT HAVE ANY MORE TEMPURA ICE CREAM!!!! 
All in all I didn't have a bad experience. The service was a lot faster than when it was doh! Of course we did go at a less busy time too. Anyways the only thing I really have against them is that they got rid of the most delicious ice cream on earth.

This was my first time here and I loved it. Great service and food. We love AYCE sushi and Yama sushi more than exceeded our expectation. My favorite part was the half roll portions that allowed us to try different rolls without waste. Will be back for sure.
I don't like putting 1 star but I had to... very bad service and food is not good. Nobody was there and it took forever

This review is strictly on service. Our waitress had the name tag Minion and that title is undeserving. Minions are way more efficient than she is. She took our order incorrectly multiple times and forgot orders we placed. It takes little to no time to write an order down while it is being placed. Write. Orders. Down.

The sushi here is mediocre. Most of our items were falling apart which was a little disappointing. Service is a hit or miss. Originally, we had this Filipino girl helping us and she was really rude. Bad attitude, doesn't smile, doesn't seem to pull her weight as a waitress. Luckily her coworkers picked up her slack. Wasn't planning on leaving a tip for such horrible service but her coworkers changed my mind thankfully.

I have to say the quality of the food has gone down since the first time I came here 8 years ago.  There are better all you can eat sushi places.  It a hole in the wall type of place but if you can I would hit tbe newer spots.

I was in Vegas for a bachelor party and a friend recommended this place. The sushi is good but customer service leaves a lot to be desired. Just a note that this is all you can eat for only certain items on the menu. There are limits on the more desirable menu items. Uni, giant clam, etc. 

Totally understandable except for when the waitress continues to take your order for said items and does not ever return. A bus boy ended up checking up on our order only to find out it was never put in after we patiently waited 30+ minutes. The manager apologized and explained sometimes the waitress make mistakes and take orders they shouldn't. 

It happens but shouldn't our table have been notified so that we could re-order other items instead of our waitress "disappearing"? Seems like a total move to reduce the amount of food our table could order. It now makes a lot of sense why all the staff have "character" themed names and not their real ones displayed on their name tags. I will not be returning here and I do not recommend this place for an all you can eat experience.
We waited 45 mins and no one took our order. There were 2 servers chit chatting because their conversation seem to be more important :) (walked out after 50 mins)
One of the best all you can eat sushi restaurant in Vegas. Nice atmosphere and delicious food! I love their sweet shrimp and seafood salad.

We were on vacay and a local brought us to experience this restaurant. It is all you can eat, or you can just order off the menu. Unfortunately, I wasn't feeling the best so I just ordered a few rolls. The spicy tuna and philly rolls did not disappoint. I was called "basic" for ordering those. Oh well, I probably am! 
Others at our table did get the AYCE. There is a 2 hour time limit. You pay for what you do not eat. You cannot just eat the goodies and leave the rice (like for real someone did that) it's 23.95$ which I personally think is a deal. The servers were nice and attentive, the place was packed. Don't be scared about the fact it's in a strip mall! Looks can be deceiving

Make sure you come before 1 am, the door says last cal is 2 am and they close 2:30 am. Came in on a Tuesday at 1:20 am, server rushed us and kept saying last call is now, so order. Didn't even have time to look over the menu. This was one of my go-to late night AYCE sushi places, but maybe I'll just take my business elsewhere.

Yama sushi is one of my favorites!! Of course we always have the AYCE menu... I love that they have soft shell crab on the menu - they also have "sexy salmon" or "sexy tuna" or "sexy" any kind of nigiri - I always get the "sexy yellowtail" and the "sexy tuna" - order half rolls too , they're always great and not overwhelming so you can have more variety throughout- try #24 - #25 #7 just to name a few!

Not my first choice for AYCE SUSHI in Las Vegas
It is acceptable but just so many other AYCE to compare with, I will visit again because no wait time to be seated.

This is our go-to when we're craving ACE sushi! 
The other day, we got off to a wrong start with a rude hostess. But that quickly got turned around by attentive service we got. Shortly after we sat on our table, we got asked what we wanted to drink. Also, our server was always at sight so we never had to wait to get our orders taken which meant that we didn't really have to wait too much for sushi and appetizers.  
Love this place & their Uni is fresh! I can tell with the taste. It doesn't have that strong taste to it

Terrible experience! The only thing that kept us from walking out and not paying was our food runner, Lester. Yes you herd me right, food runner and who knows who is our server. ? I'm not a big complainers but the resin I wrote this because we had a talk to the manager and it seems like he doesn't even care so i decided to write on here. I'm not one of those customers that said it's okay at the restaurant and rant about it later. 
Receptionist girl, i don't know she keeps this job. No smile, no thank you, no welcome. I know what she does best, looking/texting on her personal phone. 
It's so sad cuz the flamingo location did such a great job and I hope this location is just a franchised. 
Back to Lester, he was so intentive way more than our unknown sever. 

At the end, I'll never be back to this location ever again. Thank you very much.

me and my friend always come here for sushi, but today's service is horrible. No soy sauce at the table and ask for two different person never come back so I have to get it myself. Soft drink refill has to wait for 20mins. some order came 30mins after. Everything happened at a not busy late Sat night.  Thank you for everything on my BIRTHDAY. 1/13/2018

Everything is fresh and tastes great, we love the all you can eat, can't beat that! Specially if you come here after work, lol. Place is cool like this location better then the E. Flamingo location, the only down side is the parking, parking sucks, sometimes you have to park in the back of the building and walk all the way around, i guess it's a good exercise after you do the all you can eat!
Friendly staff, and clean! Good Job Yama Sushi!!!

I came here because of Yelp reviews that said they had a peanut butter roll. Well, "that was the old place" was said a few times as I tried to get things people raved about on here. OK, the AYCE was priced average for what we are used to paying. The service was pretty good because everyone that works there comes by to see if you are OK or want to order again. I did like that somewhat. There was nothing here to rave about and we have a regular sushi place that we go to in Vegas and we will be returning to there next trip. 
Just super bummed and felt like a "Bait and switch" kinda. Yelp needs to make places start over when the business changes it's name or ownership. IMO

Lol at all these salty people writing bad reviews just because their "favorite" sushi spot got taken over. How can you expect a different restaurant to serve the same type of sushi that you're used to? 

Personally, I love the new look. Came here on a Saturday night and was seated 20mins later on CES weekend. Since every restaurant on Spring Mtn had a wait, we looked no further. Everything seemed promising until I was handed over a dirty menu with soy sauce stains all over it. My miso soup tasted like bleach. I had also ordered a few nigiri rolls with Quail egg at an extra charge- but it somehow came out not inside the roll. Not sure why the server didn't even apologize or offer to make me another one. 

Me and my boyfriend also couldn't help but notice how every single roll going out to tables were abnormally ginormous... with too much rice. Like a ridiculous amount that I could possibly be full after 2 rolls. Wow Vegas, you like this kinda AYCE? You like to eat ALL YOU CAN EAT RICE?  

Cute server uniforms, creative name badges, water and tea refilled spontaneously. Pretty wall they had installed on the right which looks like you're somewhere in the Himalayas. Other than that, will not be coming back. 

If you're a visitor then you're better off somewhere else. Jjanga's, Umiya, Sushi Takashi are excellent alternatives not far from where you are.
Not  Doh sushi anymore! The food was just horrible, Yama rolls were just soaked in starch and oil.
Awesome again!! Great service and awesome food once again.. coming back next time we in Vegas

Yummy food, AWESOME SERVICE! They kept making sure we had refills and cleared the table considerably and consistently. All you can eat offers half orders of the rolls so you can try more variety. Happy to tip the waiters, chefs and staff for a stellar experience
Nice place and good environment, with excellent service. Most definitely see myself coming back
The food looks very different from what were posted here. The food wasn't fresh and service was bad. I would not recommend this place at all.

Great new sushi place in Chinatown! Came here during lunch time and it was not too busy. Great inviting atmosphere and very spacious. There was 4 of us in our party and we were seated immediately. We chose a booth. 

At this moment, the host asked for our drinks which was cool because we were really thirsty from this hot afternoon. I truly liked how clean their table was and the menu was easy to read with a wide variety of items to choose from. We all chose to eat all you can eat. 

The server introduced herself and asked us if we were ready to order. Of course we were and ordered a lot of different sashimi and special rolls. All came out surprisingly fast for being a tad busy and seeing only 2 chefs at the bar. 

All the sushi was beautifully presented and the quality and taste was great! Loved how the dessert section you get to choose 2 scoops of ice cream and 1 mochi which was a plus!

Love this sushi place and this really hit the spot! Prices was cheap too compared to other competitors.

I've been eating at this ayce location for a few times now. The reason is because the price is reasonable and their Hamachi kama is really good. Their sushi is ok to me. The tend to add more rice on the second time around when you order. I love their salmon belly but sometimes they are out. It's not bad for the price of ayce. I would suggest they should be consistent with the rice instead of adding way too much. It should be proportionate.

I came here for the first time with my boyfriend tonight and I PROMISE you we will be coming back. We sat at the bar, right in front of sushi baby .. He was AWESOME !! I LITERALLY CANT WAIT TO GO BACK ! Don't even get me started on the fish and chips ...  I will have good dreams tonight

It's unfortunate this place is no longer Doh. We were seated by the hostess. Someone can and promptly took our drink order. That was it. No one came after that. We sat for 20min with out a server checking in with us, besides the busser. We couldn't even make eye contact with anyone as they just came and went and walked away. At one point a girl came looking for a table that had ordered Unagi. I told her it wasn't us, because we haven't ordered yet as no one has come since we sat. Instead of apologizing for poor service or showing any concern she just slowly said "ookay" rolls her eyes and walks away looking for the table. From where we sat I could clearly see 2 other tables looking around waiting to be helped. One guy in the booth waved to the hostess as she walked by, instead she helped the busser adjust and prepare another table for guest!? How? If you can't serve the people you have now why would you seat more? The guy in the booth. Behind us continued to be ignored. We got up and walked out, and the hostess "thanked us" for coming. 

This was our first time here. Whatever the reason for poor service, it's a shame they showed lack of concern for the people who fund their business.

AYCE $23.95

Can't go wrong with AYCE. 

The poke bowl was amazing and a decent appetizer portion size. 

Highly recommended Sushi restaurant and definitely a popular Vegas choice.

For a buffet style restaurant, it was great! 
The food was like a great sushi place! 
I ate more nigiri then I ever ate before :-) :-) 

Order everything fresh! The waitress was excellent 
All of them helped you at anytime!

They got lower reviews cause of the previous restaurant they took over the yelp. 
But their first restaurant has great reviews, so we tried it. We love it. Will come back if we visit Vegas again

Amazing!  Such a better atmosphere, more attentive and friendlier staff, and a much bigger space compared to the other yama sushi location! !!! Only downside is that most of their option of rolls are spicy. I wish they had more of a variety

This place is pretty decent but not as good as Kama Sushi.  The selection was average and the taste was ok.  My favorite was the fish jaw.. lots of meat on that thing.  

Place was clean, airy and bright.  Nice modern décor.  Hostess was friendly and very attentive.  Food didn't take long to come out at all.  This was an all you can eat so we took advantage of rolls we wouldn't normally order. 

Again, nice looking place, decent price for all you can eat and if there wasn't Kama sushi, we'd come here again.

Overall, I really enjoy coming to this restaurant for all you can eat sushi. I've been here about three times now and the staff is always very friendly and attentive. This place is more spacious than most sushi places which is great when you have large parties or eating with the family. Our orders came out fast and very well prepared. Plus the price is great for all you can eat! The only thing I would warn is that the plaza can get busy during peak hours and parking a nightmare, so plan ahead.

This location is so much better than the one by UNLV. Great value for AYCE and even better service. We tried this location for the first time Friday night, and even though there was a 30-minute wait, it was well worth it. All the fish was fresh and melted in our mouths... we will be back!

Such an amazing change.

A total flip from yhe last time we were here on Mothers day. The venue has an amazing staff that kept things moving, clean, filled and HAPPY throughout our dine in.

Greeted and seated in record time. Our server did not skip a beat to take care of us as soon as we got seated. If you read my reviews, you know how we order when it comes to sushi. Abundance!

What ordered:

Appetizers -

Baked green mussels
Fried green mussels
Mix poke salad
Seafood salad
Salmon kama
Miso soup
Tofu agedashi
Soft-shell crab

Negiri -

Salmon
Yellowtail
White tuna
Uni
Sweet shrimp with head
Albacore
Salmon roe

Sushi -

Double salmon hand roll
Spicy tuna roll
Ellen roll
No name roll

Desert -

Green tea ice cream
Mango mochi

I'm pretty sure that I'm missing more. But yes, we are now back to being regulars here. Fish to rice ratio is perfect. The baked mussels compared to Kaya is so much better. Not drowned in the cream cheese sauce and use whole mussels, not combining small ones to make it look huge. Timing on distribution was immaculate considering we order alot. As soon as a plate left, another took its place. No cluttered table, and no empty glasses. For the price point, value and quality, Yama hit the spot this night. 


In addition to the food, the service was on par tonight. No wait time in between ordering what so ever. Definitely a great improvement and a nice turn around. Well earned 5 stars.

Nice atmosphere came in while in the area for late lunch, menu has good variety and the fish is fresh I have to say it's amazing that they are open 7 days a week til 2:30am I will keep this on my radar for late night dinners

First time was a week ago and than today  me and my boss went and it was amazing , We got seated right away both times , Got taken care of the servers are very attentive with us got us our drink right away , Get our orders in and the unlimited sushi is the best thing on the menu .  I have tried at least half of the menu and everything is so good . Favorite spot .

You guys! This spot has the best sushi I've tasted thus far in this town!!!!!! The appetizers are amazing and they have plenty of rolls that do not contain raw fish! I love that!!! Service is fast although being seated may take a while. Parking takes a while as well so plan for that. Food is made fresh and the interior decor is cool and out of this world. There's a huge screen which I like that displays pictures. Liking is pleasant and appealing as well. Now, the bathroom is dirty and definitely need a cleaning! Other than that, this trendy sushi spot is the bees knees!

Great sushi and all you can eat! As of this writing it is $20.95 for lunch, $23.95 for dinner. Great Rolls, great quality. Amazing service, open till 2:30am. Dim sum apps included, as well as Kochi for dessert. Love it. This place rocks!

We decided to try the AYCE lunch ($20.95). They have so many different choices so you better come hungry. I recommend the "Son of the Beach" and "Crazy Roll". They're  #7 and #26 on the specialty roll menu. They were the tastiest and most memorable for my boyfriend and I. We also love our yellow tail tuna nigiri sushi. Nice and simple with some soy sauce and wasabi. Good Hamachi is what makes us keep coming back for more.

The service was very fast and very attentive. They went out of their way to make good menu recommendations and never let our drinks go dry. Definitely one of the better sushi places we've tried since moving to Las Vegas. Can't beat the price for AYCE also.

They used to be named, "Doh Sushi & Tapas" but renamed to Yama Sushi. This restaurant is the "cousin" I would say to Tofu Hut KBBQ and Doh KBBQ. I occasionally go to this sushi spot and had been here since they have opened a few years ago, and I they have improved. Parking is pretty difficult to find, especially on weekends but the wait time at this place is short. Whenever I get there it is empty or I get there before the rush starts. 

They have a modern touch to their environment and I really like the ambiance. Since I have been there I have not experienced a stable server, which is fine because every server around (although they are assigned) are easily accessible if we needed a refill on a drink or to place another order. Portioning is a lot to me and they do not offer half sized rolls upon me asking so beware of that. I really love their garlic tuna out of everything else on the menu and when it comes to dessert their ice-cream banana tempura is delicious. The banana tempura is a part of the AYCE (TYJ!!!) usually some places only limit you one mochi per person but they do not do that with the tempura. Dinner price is about $26 per person for AYCE but I am not sure about lunch price because I have never experienced lunch here. 

***LAST CALL is 12:30/1am*** I remember coming to this place around that time and they said they could not serve me because they closed at 2:30am, and that was not enough time for their sushi chef's to bring out our orders in time. Last call is pretty earlier than most places because I have been to another sushi spot that closes at 2am and still accepted people at 1:30/1:45am.

Yama sushi on Spring Mt is by far a go to restaurant. My favorite part about this establish ent is the quick service, great portion from fish to rice ratio, and how spacious it is inside. Will be back for another round of a sushi with friends.

Portion sizes were fair, taste was pretty good, and seating was comfortable.

Didn't like the largely added gratuity!

Gave me the worst tummy ache afterwards!

Yama sushi has always been one of my all time favs. This location is much larger and much more spacious than the one on Maryland. Service was super fast and amazing! Staff was beyond friendly. They all worked with one another to get food out quick, ask us for additional orders and constantly kept dirty plates from sitting on our table. 

If I was to change one thing, it would be the interior design. It was kinda blah. Didn't have a welcoming or exciting feel to it. 

Other than that service was great, staff was great, food was fresh and amazing!

Price is unbeatable! $23.95 for dinner AYCE!

All you can eat was a great price and included appetizers and mochi/ ice cream. There were a lot of different sushi to try and they were creative. Service was amazing, anyone nearby would check to see if you needed help constantly. Also the decor was really nice and clean

This is probably my favorite ayce sushi joint in the Las Vegas area. They have the fresher slices of raw sushi and they don't overload the rice. I also like how the rice when it's warm. Other places pre make the rice and it ends up cold and hard. 

Like other ayce the rolls are available for half size which is about 4 slices. The uni here was surprisingly not that fishy and the giant clam was fresh! Definitely get the sweet shrimp too! The fried shrimp head was such a great surprise!

Garlic tuna was good but don't dip it in soy sauce... there is already sauces on it and if you do then the sushi becomes way too salty.

The only negative thing was a weird smell in the restaurant... it wasn't Clorox smell but it wasn't entirely a nice smell either. I randomly smelt it while I was eating and it kind of brought the experience down.

One tip: get the red bean ice cream at the end! It was a taste I've never had before!

I loved this place. Didn't realize there were 2 of these places. This one in particular was amazing and they were packed. I went in with a friend of mine and we did their AYCE sushi. 

I cant begin to tell you how quick and attentive they were. When I say quick I mean we had 2 hours to kill and after ordering 5 separate times we still had a little less than an hour to go. I was stuffed and for $23.95 its a hell of a deal compared to some other sushi places. 

Their Deep Fried Muscles were amazing!!! All in all I would totally recommend this place to anyone looking for a great sushi restaurant!

Well, I have heard nothing but good things about this restaurant. Tried it and it was very good. Large portions for AYCE. Prob to much brought to the table Handmade. Great service because your not assigned just one waiter. Everyone on the shift comes to serve and pickup the plates.
Very quick sushi prep, clean.  Don't leave food because the waiter will remind you about wasting rice etc.$$.
Stumbled onto this place. Great selection and very fresh. Screaming deal for all you can eat with everything they offer. Will definitely come back.

This is an awesome place that has hamachi coma, bbq ribs every nigiri fish there is and the white tuna is the best in town. I love the ice cream balls  at the end of dinner. The service is super and they keep it coming u til you say no more. It's off the strip but 1/4 the price and it's clean and great place.

The food here is so great. The staff is extremely good hearted. Affordable. Sushi portions and sizes are perfect. Good order turn around time. Only recommendation is the front of house needs a full time host. Honey bunny is fantastic but she's definitely busy! Venelope is a GREAT waitress and person. Will definitely be coming here a lot more.

All I can say is this place really sucks I waited for almost 20 min for a waiter to come and take my order mind i actually had to tell the busser to get me a waiter . Menu here is not the greatest . Selection is very small here I fell like I was invisible here o well never coming here again
The best all you can eat sushi in town. They have a huge selection of specialty rolls and their hamachi Kama is so good. My favorite sushi roll is the wet dream. You got to try it.
Great sushi and amazing rolls! This place has a great selection and everything tasted great. I would recommend this spot anytime in Vegas

Yama Sushi is this AYCE spot in Chinatown! They always have a massive wait, but it's a good spot if you want cheap sushi fast. 

I ordered the tiger roll and spicy edamame as appetizers and they are SPICY! I was not a big fan. Usually the spice meter isn't that spicy on spicy tuna and edamame. Heads up, ask for mild if possible. 

I also ordered the yama roll which was the best one on the menu in my opinion. The quality of fish isn't that great, but you do get what you pay for. 

The dessert was the best part my opinion. Haha I ordered the strawberry & mango. Also, pistachio nut ice cream.

Very disappointed. Every single roll, and every single nigiri we ordered was sitting on a puddle of 'ponzu.' (Ponzu is in quotations because it tsted like straight malt vinegar) even if it didn't specify that it would be there, it was. This resulted in soy paper becoming soggy and unwrap from the rolls. It causes the rice, which was rather chewy, to crumble upon pick-up and impossible to stay together. It all just fell apart. All the rolls ended up tasting the  same. No matter what different ingredients, they all just tasted like vinegar. Maybe the fish was smelly, and they did this to disguise it? Tempura was lukewarm and chewy/old tasting. Green mussels were the equivalent of chewing an ear. Firecracker had dried out overcooked spicy tuna inside that they tried to hide with a quart of mayo. Green tea ice cream tasted like an old lady's perfume. We're not surprised the place was dead. Service was very friendly and fast, so there's that, but we won't be returning.

This place was good when it uses to be doh. 
Yama sushi is nasty. 
 There's one on flamingo and Maryland parkway , if I liked it I would go there . 
 It's very upsetting that this location changed, we used to come every week . 
We will never return , guess now we have to find another place .

Yama is still the best all you can eat sushi in the West. 

This is my first time at this particular location on Spring Mountain. It was open at midnight on a Tuesday and therefore we went. 

The sashimi, Yama rolls and all of the other rolls that are included in the $25 can't be beat. Included was also miso soup and edename and some ice cream. 

We ate until we hit the food wall. My only regret is that I couldn't eat anymore. Everything we tried was delicious. Ask for the yellowtail belly. Spicy tuna, exceptional. The Yama sauce, I wish I could buy. The sushi chefs were extremely friendly and knowledgeable and told us exactly what we should order. 

Fantastic experience, can't wait to go back to Yama!
Came here for dinner and loved it. Really loved the mussels and Wet Dream Roll. The service was really nice and friendly.

3.5/5 stars for the exceptional service we got but with a few disappointments with the food. We came in on a Saturday at 6:30pm and our party of 4 was seated within 10-15 min which was great! As soon as we sat down our server came and got our orders since we already knew what we wanted. It was funny because the whole time we felt that we had 5+ servers for our table since they all kept stopping by our table making sure we were alright, taking our orders, dropping off the food, refilling our drinks constantly etc! The food came out super quick as well which was a huge plus considering our AYCE sushi experiences have us waiting years for our food to come out! 

Overall, the food was just ok. The miso soup was very salty which made it hard for me to eat. Their dessert selection wasn't very appealing for they only had ice cream and mochi. I was really looking forward to some tempura type of dessert but sadly that wasn't on the menu. Rolls that were great were the "Harry Potter" and "No Name" so I'd give those a try! Also, for pricing it's $23.95 for AYCE dinner from 3pm-2:30am.

Like with any AYCE sushi place, you get your money's worth here just bc of all the options available. But I judge a sushi place based on their nigiri, and I'm sad to say I was disappointed here. The sashimi pieces were rather dry and the rice was lacking in flavor, like not enough rice vinegar. Their menu for nigiri was rather small, not as much variety that I'm used to, and missing some standards in my opinion. But they have a large variety of cooked rolls. The rolls, however, were really delicious and kind of what saved this place for me, 3 stars instead of 2. Their baked and deep fried rolls all sound amazing on the menu, and the flavor doesn't disappoint. But again, if I don't like the nigiri, I feel like I wasted my time. I don't really eat rolls at all, but I felt the need to try them here to really get the value for what I paid ($23.90 AYCE dinner). 

The service was great, orders were taken and delivered promptly. All of the servers were really nice and attentive, and I thought it was cute how all their name tags are cartoon characters. 

If you like COOKED "sushi," then definitely give this place a try. But if you're like me and prefer the nigiri and real raw stuff, you'd do better to look elsewhere.

Best all you can eat sushi place I've ever been to (not only Las Vegas but all over). Sweet Shrimp, No Name roll, Sun of the Beach roll, and Trust Me Baby roll were particular favorites. Awesome service with 6-7 different waiters and waitresses constantly asking if we wanted to put more food orders in. Tab would have easily exceeded $140 for two of us anywhere else but ended up under $60. 

Definitely worth the Uber from the strip or if you find yourself in Chinatown

Horrible experience! Found plastic wraps still on one of our rolls. Asked for a manager and got a supervisor who was not empowered to do anything. Called owner at the other location and he argued with me over a refund. Instead he wanted to offer me a free meal at the Flamingo location. He blamed my experience on the restaurant being new and that the first location has been around for several years and he would take care of us. I was not interested. I disputed with my card company and was denied. All I wanted was a refund for the damn PLASTIC in our food. We should have choked on it and sued, but I am an honest person. The owner boasts he's worked for MGM Resorts, but if that was true he would know that they take care if their guests. I would never pay for plastic in my food at ANY restaurant that MGM owns.

Best sushi in town hands down! Everything is so fresh. The service was tremendous! Make sure you look for Leslie and request her as your server. Definitely less wait time than the one on flamingo because it's bigger!

I had dinner here last night and it was surprisingly pleasing, judging by its (current) 3.5 stars. First, the price was not bad for dinner at about $25 after tax. Second, service came around quickly and so did the food. There was no waiting around for anyone or any dish. Sometimes food that I ordered came around so quick I thought they meant it for the other table! Third, food was delicious. I was very pleased with the uni because I've had bad uni before and this was not it. The yellowtail was also nice and fresh. The rolls were also delicious, there was this one called sunset dreams or something that we all loved and kept ordering. Fourth, you can order half rolls! This way you get to try a roll without getting full. Fifth, there's a good selection of appetizers. I thought the soft-shell crab was a delicious item, and one that I hadn't seen in many restaurants. A lot of places service the spider roll but just the crab on its own is a whole another ball game. The yellowtail collar was also good as well. Finally, nice clean atmosphere and spacious setting. Overall, I loved it here and had great food that didn't take forever or cost a ton of money.

My son and I like coming here because it doesn't matter if you come to lunch or dinner you can get the same menu items the only difference is the price you're pay which is a 3 dollar difference.  The kama is good here because you can get both hamachi and salmon kama.  We find the seafood salad creamy style is really good and you get alot for the portion.  Takoyaki balls are the best among the ayce places.  Definitely will be coming back again

Wow! Wow! Wow! This place is hands down one of the best sushi joints in Las Vegas!! Extremely friendly staff with funny ass name tags! Every time we ordered food it was right at our table within minutes!! Man! All you can eat for $24 - Yes please!!! Food was so fresh!!! You won't be disappointed!!!

Went to this location for the first time. Me and my bosses went here for lunch around 1.30pm. We had miso soup and it was a little salty. Together with miso soup we had soft shell crab , mussels, takoyaki (very disappointing), seafood salad, tofu, kama and some nigiri. Then my stomach started to act up. I am a sushi lover and never felt sick while eating it. UNI my favorite was disgusting! It taste bitter. The fish in our nigiri is not cold.. we told our server about it and he apologize and he said we need to comment on yelp coz a lot of people complain. He even said since they changed it from Doh to Yama they started buying low class cheaper seafoods/fish. He even told us that the sushi makers were stressed. Lol. And then I told him I feel sick. My stomach hurts he just told me to comment too at yelp! So here it goes..

I FELT SICK EATING HERE!! 

Been coming back to the toilet since I got home! 
Not coming back to this Location ever!!!

I was shocked when I saw Yama2 only has 3 1/2 stars on yelp! This place is 5/5 in my book. I love their AYCE menu. It has appetizers galore for those who want to hang out but aren't huge fans of traditional sushi. There are plenty of nirigri options and the lunch menu really isn't that different than the dinner (highly recommend coming for lunch, so you safe a few $$). The specialty rolls are great and I love that you can order half rolls of pretty much anything! That way you can try them all and not worry about trying to finish everything.

I love the fish quality here. I've never had anything short of fresh and delicious. Their nigiri uses a little bit of rice, unlike some places that try to fill you up with cold, hard chunks of rice and charge you for it!

Service is always quick, even when they are busy. They're also very friendly whenever I come too.

Pro tip: if you want to try and space out your food but don't want to wait to order, make sure you order some nigiri and non baked items at the same time as the deep fried, or specialty things. This makes all the food come out in small batches, but you only have to order a couple of times and you don't have to try and flag down your server! 

Another pro tip: try it all. You'll love it.

Good sushi with an even better price. The service is very prompt, get used to multiple servers taking your orders and bringing out endless rounds of sushi. It's one of my favorite ayce spots in town. The Harry Potter roll is one of my favorites.

Ehh.... rolls were the size of gas station sushi, disguised with a lot of rice. Don't be fooled by the photos- rolls are the size of a half dollar coin. 

Service was decent but they forgot our miso and brought us an extra salad and hinted that it was our fault when we told them at the time of ordering appetizer we didn't want it anymore. Didn't really taste a lot of the fish since it was masked in a ton of sauce. 

Overall restaurant seems to cater to those who want the ayce experience and haven't had decent sushi before... if you catch my drift............

Usually we have amazing service here. Tonight, was an exception. Our waiter "Johnny Bravo" was the worst human being ever. Lazy. Had an attitude. Can't take an order correctly. If you can't work with people, don't work in the hospitality world. He either needs to be retrained or fired.

I can tell you this Yama Sushi blows away Sake 2 Me in Tustin CA. Everything from the rice and the eel you can taste better quality ingredients and flavors. Their appetizers was great they got a big piece of the Hamachi Kama and the BBQ short ribs was flavorful. Overall their service and food is better than any AYCE sushi place I've been to.

I'm not a real fan of all-you-can-eat.  This place, however, seems to be a local favorite.  The wait staff are pretty friendly and attentive, constantly checking up for any other things we would like to try.  I loved the ahi poke, shrimp tempura, soft-shell crab...the rolls were pretty decent as well.  I don't mind going back.

It was really awful. The fish tasted like ammonia. I started feeling sick yesterday before we even left. Still feel like shit. Honestly I wish I was lucky enough to have been ignored by the servers like the reviewer below.  Never again.

This is one of my most favorite sushi places in town! I've been here multiple time since my first review. Their signature rolls are delicious! This sushi restaurant has the best and longest list of appetizers I've seen in a sushi restaurant, hands down. The staff is really attentive and polite--sometimes they forget to smile, but it's usually when they are getting overwhelmed.  All in all, good AYCE sushi place to eat off the strip!

Love the all you can eat sushi such a reasonable price plus the service is a1 they always bring it out on time and waiters are amazing and ever since I first came I fell in love thanks for great sushi place

Love this place! I like the location on Flamingo a little better, but usually go to this one since it's closer to me. They have a full menu (double sided) and do have a la carte items. My family and I usually do the all you can eat menu option. It's waaaaay worth it because we order an appetizer, salad, various rolls, then ice cream. So far during all my visits all the servers are friendly, good customer service. Really busy around dinner time, but what great food place isn't? Definitely recommend the soft shell crab and Dragon roll!

New upgrade from the old Yama Sushi! This place is very spacious and can now accommodate parties bigger than 8, it is much more convenient. The service has definitely gotten better since the old location, maybe due to more staff? Our server, Maria always checked up on us and notice the small things (taking our plates, refills, ordering more food, etc.,) She was on top of things, I loved that. 

The food came out pretty fast. The sushi proportion is perfect, 75% sushi and 25% rice that's how it should be done. The salmon felt like butter, it melts in your mouth so perfectly. I recommend getting the yellowtail Kama, it comes with lemon and ponzu sauce it's so good (although it's limited to 1 per person), their Amaebi (sweet shrimp) is bomb too, you get the option of rather or not you want the shrimp's head which is battered and deep fried. Love coming here, one of my favorite sushi places.

Overall this is a decent sushi joint. The atmosphere feels like a buffet. The waiters are friendly and the food was good. Lots of foot traffic during dinner time. The only problem I could name was that the waiters got confused with other table and kept bringing random food to our table that we didn't order. Which I thought was kinda funny. Also the bathrooms were some what clean. I would go back here.

Disappointed with the serving sizes. I was here a year ago and it was double the size. Check the photo to see how management is cutting they're food costs. They used to be an amazing restaurant but now they overcharge for below average food and serving sizes. Such a shame. :(

Came here with my boyfriend for a quick bite before drinks at the Golden Tiki. Since it was just the two of us we told the hostess we'll just sit at the sushi bar. They weren't too busy for being on a Saturday night.. no wait for a regular table and pretty open seating. When we got to the sushi bar the sushi chef Ginie I believe his name was greeted us immediately. He was very nice and attentive. We had ordered two rolls and got them super quickly, but we didn't even have waters or anything, while we've already been sitting at the empty sushi bar for 15 minutes. Nearly done with our rolls I had to stop a waitress to ask for water.... and only 2 mins after I asked another waitress came and asked if anyone got our drink order. Thanks but, you were 15 minutes too late. The food was delicious, but service was nothing to return for.

It's my third time here this month and both times WOMENS RESTROOM IS BROKEN!!!! Come on you guys! You have to have a restroom if you are dealing with food! I can't even wash my hands, what's the matter with you, it's a must in a restaurant!!!

This place is absolutely amazing. The service was phenomenal. The sushi was HIGH QUALITY. I was almost expecting this place to be "Meh" but I was pleasantly surprised. Roll after roll I was just shocked. It was literally nirvana. you literally can't beat this place. HIGH quality sushi and GREAT AYCE price. This is my new go to sushi spot.

Me and my boyfriend took a chance to come here on V-Day and surprisingly it wasn't that bad of a wait, 30 mins compared to the hour or longer at their sister location. This was his first time here and was he wow'd. I had take him to Goyemon for his birthday last year and he was impressed but this place just blew him away. The service was very good and attentive. We noticed they all had nicknames so our mission that night was to find out all the different names floating around. All their dishes were on point as far as tastiness and freshness. It kept up to the same level as their primary location if not more, because the staff at this location was a lot more customer service oriented. The only thing I found disappointing was the limit on one type of dessert- you can only get one mochi and one scoop of ice cream rather than two mochi's or two scoops of ice cream. When did that change?  Either than that, everything was FABULOUS!

The food & atmosphere was pretty decent. But the waiters were not attentive at all, mixed orders, forgot what we ordered, never came to check up. Maria was our waitress. Carlos was super nice and went above and beyond with us, he needs to become a manager, only good service!!
